esh-adventure-rp
Summary
Welcome to #esh-adventure-rp! This is the start of the #esh-adventure-rp channel.
DM [Esh] BOT 09-01-2024 17:34
### A Raven's Hunt (Lila's Arc Quest)
DM [Esh] BOT 09-01-2024 17:34
Grimy, sweat, caked in both mud and blood - none of which was hers - and Lila couldn't be happier. Relatively. The huntress had just completed her latest hunt. A wily beast that was stalking a caravan. The crew met her on the road, seeing her equipment pleading with her. Their life was in danger and they would pay. The coin was nice but the description intrigued her - well, there was none of the creature but only of its signs and tracks. The caravan believed they were purposefully left by the beast to taunt them. After finding a few herself she came to the same conclusion and smiled. After some time, the beast had been tracked. A ferocious creature but at the end of it was no match for the Raven's Huntress.... The Raven's Huntress... Lila had felt the desolation and feelings of forlorn hope from the lack of communication from her Matron, the Raven Queen for some time now. It has been a while, a long while and her sense of purpose has been wavering. What is a loyal servant without her Mistress? What kind of all-powerful diety cannot even communicate with her faithful? And if She cannot - or will not does She even deserve Lila's servitude? Throwing the thoughts from her mind Lila instead throws herself into cleaning her weapons and gear. A dirty and broken bow could determine the death on the wrong end of it instead. Her clothes are filthy too but she'll get to that when she's done. Nearly finished Lila then starts with her armor, ensuring the protection it offers is still intact, and the dirt and grime does not cause any rust or deterioration. Now to her clothing... ## CAAAAWWWW
1
DM [Esh] BOT 09-01-2024 17:34
Panicked, the shadar kai moves like lightning. Dropping the garment, picking up her bow, nocking and drawing an arrow in one quick, fluid movement. Furious at herself for being surprised, Lila points her arrow at the intruder. A lone raven on a twisted, gnarled tree limb. ## CAAWWW The raven bellows again keeping eye contact with the one wielding the bow that very well may end its life. The raven rotates it's head, maintaining eye contact the entire time. Lila blinks. A raven? A sign from the Raven Queen or a twisted Barovian joke? Lila keeps the bow taut for another moment. The raven flies to another tree's branch, ignoring Lila completely. Holding the bow at only air, the huntress eventually releases the draw but keeps her arrow nocked and turns to look at the raven again. ## CAWWW If a bird can appear impatient this one seems like it reached that point ages ago. Giving Lila one last look it then leaps off the branch and flies through the poor excuse of a forest's leafless canopy.
Lila BOT 09-01-2024 19:19
Lila eyes the bird warily as it flies away. You can never be too careful in Barovia -- what appears to be a simple animal could be something far more dangerous... She should feel relief at its departure, but in truth she had been hopeful that its arrival was portent of something greater. She briefly considers shooting it down out of plain spite. "But you're not worth the arrow," she mutters.
Lila BOT 09-01-2024 22:25
With her equipped tended to, Lila packs up and heads back to town.
DM [Esh] BOT 09-01-2024 22:44
Traveling back to town on a road she had taken countless times before, on a path she had tracked, scouted and stalked countless times before, the huntress prowls forward with minimal effort. Minimal effort does not mean minimal awareness though. The Raven Queen's huntress is always aware of their surroundings. Of the path forward, the nearest and most accessible method of retreat, the presence of both friend and foe alike. Which is why Lila let out an unnatural scream ## CAAAWWW When another raven appeared in the branches above her completely undetected. This one, a different one. Obviously. It was a scream of frustration of course. Followed by a whistling dagger shot from Lila's hip without a moment's hesitation. It didn't hit her mark, which she found odd - but a few feathers lightly floated down as the raven flew out of sight. This feeling. Something the huntress had rarely felt. There was the frustration of losing communication with her mistress but she is getting over that. But if she can't fully trust her own skills then what can she rely on?
Lila BOT 09-01-2024 23:19
Lila picks up one of the fallen feathers and holds it up to the wan light of the Barovia sky. Could the creature be some wayward emissary from one of her misguided brethren? (edited)
DM [Esh] BOT 10-01-2024 03:49
Lila spins the feather in her fingertips. The sheen of the feather reflects the light of the gloomy moon and reminds Lila of another time, another place... An unkindness of ravens fly past a young Lila's face, several loose feathers fall and spiral to the ground. "Your tasks, my dear hunters and huntresses are as follows...." A striking woman veiled in shadows and draped in flowing, ethereal robes of raven feathers commands to the host of shadar kai before her. Her violet eyes, simultaneously holding an otherworldly wisdom and unending madness pierce the gaze of those before her offering a stern look of approval before moving on to the next. Upon reaching Lila's eyes the Raven Queen holds her gaze on Lila's for only a fraction longer compared to the rest, lips twitching into what may be thought of as a smile then quickly on to the next... Back in Barovia, feather still in her fingers. Lila twists it once more, this time noticing it isn't exactly the same feathers as those ravens from the Raven Queen's court. Possibly at one point, but this feather seems to have been twisted by the realm the raven and huntress currently reside in.... This raven was a raven of her Mistress but Lila can sense it is no longer tethered to Her. It no longer maintains its status as the Raven Queen's eyes and ears but it still must hold some of Her essence. A series of caws and crowing snaps Lila out of reverie. Surrounding the huntress is a flock, or an 'Unkindness' as they are called, of ravens above the treetops calling to her. Beckoning her.
Lila BOT 10-01-2024 03:57
<So you, too, were once part of Her entourage.> Lila thinks as she gazes at the feather. She feels a bitter kinship between herself and the bird -- make that birds. She tucks the feather behind one pointed ear and sets off toward the congregation of corvids. She remains wary, of course, having as little trust of the birds as she does of her own kin. But an omen such as this begs to be investigated.
DM [Esh] BOT 10-01-2024 16:08
As one the ravens leap off their perches and take to the sky. The black forms dart forward becoming a blur racing through the treetops. Lila picks up her pace to match their speed. Hurdling over stumps and dodging stray tree limbs, the huntress feels her heart racing. The mass of ravens maintain their speed and the two forces race on. They eventually make it to the village of Barovia and most of the flock fly off but an ample remain, circling overheard to ensure that Lila is still with them then continue their path. It is late, and most of the village inhabitants are asleep and off the streets so an elf following a flock of ravens isn't obviously witnessed nor causing an alarm. Eventually the unkindness of ravens reach a less populated part of the village, its emptiness amplified even moreso in the dead of night. Here the buildings are less maintained and cared for, some even abandoned and in disrepair. The several remaining ravens fly over a particular house, circling several times before landing along the roof. As each bird touches down, they each face the huntress, locking their eyes with hers, none shifting their gaze away. Lila has noticed that since arriving to this area the ravens had been particularly quite, not a single one making a caw, a crow or a croak. Each a silent herald on the rooftop. Breaking through the silence of the night are some muffled voices heard from within the building the ravens are perched on.
Lila BOT 10-01-2024 16:35
Lila circles the house, moving as silently as a shadow as usual, and taking note of points of egress and any clues as to the nature of the inhabitants. (edited)
DM [Esh] BOT 10-01-2024 17:47
If it wasn't for the otherworldly ravens who's head follow her every movement Lila would have been near invisible against the gloomy village backdrop, but even with the raven eyes she was undetectable. Normally on a silent night like this, every breath taken and every scrape of boot is amplified, foretelling one's presence even at a distance but Lila is in sync with her shadow, invisibly hugging every pocket of cover and making as little sound as a shadow would make. Making a full circuit around the building, Lila determines that it offers as much fortification as it appears to - that is to say, not much. The windows and doors are all boarded up preventing any subtle entry or exit. Looking up, there is also a small second story attic window, left slightly ajar. No raven sit perched near that section of the roof. On further inspection Lila notices some claw marks around one of the boarded up windows and on a few of the covering planks. Several line-thin marks are found.
DM [Esh] BOT 10-01-2024 17:52
All throughout the scan of the house, the talking inside continues. Still muffled and unable to be made out, the hushed tones some times escalate as those inside get heated but quickly catch themselves, cool off and resume their hushed discussions.
2
DM [Esh] BOT 10-01-2024 17:55
During one such escalation, a single sigh, lined with frustration and desperation is heard clearly as the sound travels through the attic window into Lila's ears.
Lila BOT 10-01-2024 18:25
Lila weighs her options. She could snoop around more -- or maybe sneak in and get a look inside... Or she could knock on the door But what would she say? Why is she even here? She closes her eyes and feels for her mystical link to nature, that wild part of her still more connected with Life than Death. She holds up one hand to her mouth and speaks a whispered word in Old Elvish, letting it blow across her fingers before she inhales it back. [cast Speak with Animals] She gestures to the ravens on the roof to send one of their number down.
1
DM [Esh] BOT 11-01-2024 02:12
As Lila inhales the breath of magic her senses light up, particularly her hearing. foodfoodfoodfood.. Ach! Black flyers! Me no food! Run awayyyyy!! Lila hears a swarm of rats scurry at the sight of the ravens. Running underneath the rotted wood of another nearby house for cover. Nearly as quite as Lila herself, the huntress sees a cat silently stalking the swarm of rats. As it slinks through a cracked window Lila could swear she heard a chuckle. A moment later a loud shriek "MIIIIIINE!!!!!" is heard from within followed by panicked and frightened screams from the rats. Then silence once more. A minute later a triumphant cat strides out, meal in its mouth. Looking towards the ravens, Lila strains her ears to hear something from their beaks, anything at all. Nonetheless obeying the huntress's command one of the birds float down onto Lila landing on her outstretched arm. The sharp talons digging into her leather arm guard. This one bores its eyes into Lila's but still nothing uttered.... Not from this nor any of the others. caw Lila's bird finally emits a sound, unfortunately nothing she could understand. It then flies back to its perch on the rooftop. "What was that??" A voice hisses out from within the house. "Another damned bird??"
Lila BOT 11-01-2024 02:22
<There is no magic in all the planes that can force a raven not to be an asshole if it so wishes.> she thinks in response to the untranslated caw. Upon hearing the voice from the house, she slides over to flatten herself against the wall to stay out of sight if someone comes out.
DM [Esh] BOT 11-01-2024 02:44
Listening to the animal conversations surrounding her Lila is fully aware that the spell took hold. As the spell persists, she concentrates harder on the spell, focusing on the raven, this time as the sole target but.. nothing... Then she realizes, she can't understand these beasts as these ravens are no beasts at all. Despite their mundane appearances, whether some sort spirit, herald, a remote sense or harbinger, these ravens are no mundane beasts. The spell wouldn't take hold on them.
DM [Esh] BOT 11-01-2024 03:29
With this realization hanging in the air the raven lets another squawk. It and several others immediately fly off leaving only about three remaining. Right as the bulk of the flock are out of sight a rough bang is heard against the attic roof. A person then crawls from the opened attic window. The thin man, young, pale - almost deathly so sticks out and up and over the roof eaves to gain a better view of the rooftop. "SCRAM!" He yells then bangs on the rooftop to scare the birds away then immediately realizes what he's done, that he was too loud. He visibly winces at his own actions then turns around, surveying the streets below. The man did not see Lila lurking in the shadows but she had noticed he possessed burning red irises. The man shrugged and turns around crawling spider-like back through the window and out of sight. A small thump can be heard as the man jumps down to the ground floor. The hushed murmuring continuing.
Lila BOT 11-01-2024 03:45
Lila's curiosity is piqued, but she recognizes that investigating further may put her in danger. She takes a few moments to write out two nearly identical notes -- describing her location and what she has seen and explaining that she is going in to investigate. She doesn't say explicitly that she's looking for backup -- it isn't as if they would be able to get here quickly anyway. But one never wants to fall into the clutches of vampires without letting someone else know your whereabouts. Once written she slips the papers into an open pocket so that they have easy access to fly away. (Assuming all has remained quiet in this time) Lila hops on her broom and flies up to the attic window to examine how easy it would be to enter unnoticed.
DM [Esh] BOT 11-01-2024 15:20
The paper birds fly into the night to their intended targets, hopefully relaying Lila's message quickly enough. Lila quietly lands on the rooftop taking care to avoid making any sounds. Lila reaches the attic window and carefully peeks through, positioning herself to be near impossible to be seen yet giving her a direct view of what's below. Lila sees a direct view on the ground floor with only several rafters in between. Down below she sees the vampire who appeared before talking to a couple of others. Only able to make out one or two other faces - none she recognized- though all seemed nervous.... and scared. "Gah! Those birds have been driving me mad! That incessant squawking!" The one who Lila previously saw blurts out. "Do..do.. you think it's Him?? Do you think He found out? He'll kill us! No. We'd be lucky if he kills us!" A small woman with darting eyes let's out a small squeak of terror then claps her mouth shut.
1
DM [Esh] BOT 11-01-2024 15:21
Another voice speaks out from within the shadows, "We may have to just accept our fate." The voice deep and assertive yet still tinged with fear and desperation continues, "We have done all we could until now. Everything fell into place so damn perfectly, flawless. We believed we finally had a weapon to put an end to him, but let's not kid ourselves any longer. This... thing that we've unleashed, it had already utterly annihilated the majority of us, then took control over the rest of our numbers. We thought we could use It to usurp the Tyrant?? That's a laugh.. It's now somewhere in the mountains but we all know It won't be there for long. And when it does - there is no good outcome. If it does kill Strahd, then what? We've all witnessed firsthand a more twisted brutality than He had on his darkest days. An even worse outcome? The Tyrant puts It under His own control. We knew that was always a possibility and at the time we had to risk it, but now that is a strong possibility. With It... by His side.. No. I refuse to even think on that fate. And It's only a fledgling now. It's only growing in power as we speak." A small chuckle escapes his lips, "Maybe a group of those scourge who keep coming in through the Mists will deal with it. Killing them all at the same time. That'll be a miracle from that useless Morning Lord himself." Lila still invisible above the clandestine room, hears all. The darkness becoming thick and choking, becomes a realm of uncertainty. Shadows stretch, emphasizing the ominous doubts that now envelope the spawns' desperation.
1
1
Lila BOT 11-01-2024 16:44
While she watches and listens Lila takes a few moments to apply her flask of radiant blade oil to six of her magefire arrows. Just in case
Lila BOT 11-01-2024 21:57
Lila slips through the window and hovers above the room, sitting sidesaddle on her broomstick. "One of those scourge, as you so delicately put it, is most curious to find out more of what you speak," she announces in a hauty tone. She descends a few feet into the room (still at least 15 feet up), her longbow resting on her lap. "You have unleashed something dangerous, yes? And you need it... dealt with?" She looks at the three figures and awaits a reply, drumming her fingers on the bow as she waits.
DM [Esh] BOT 12-01-2024 03:28
At the sudden appearance of the the silent intruder several of the vampires hiss at Lila with raised claws and lowered fangs ready to pounce. Amongst the shadows Lila notices more vampires. Less than a dozen, but even with her darkvision it was hard to get an exact count as many were contorted within the shadowy crevasses of the old house. Gauging the strength and conditions of these spawn, they still were not a match for the adept huntress but their numbers did give her pause. Using their spider-climbing abilities a few of the vampires were leveled with the Huntress, fangs readied. "Hold!" A sharp bark is heard from the ground floor. The dismayed vampire who had all but despaired just moments ago now has a spark in his crimson eyes. The legion of vampire spawn have settled down on the command, lowering their claws and putting away their fangs, they all obey, some scowling, looking for a fight, while others just glad that it didn't lead to one, clearly demoralized and disheartened. The lead vampire directs his gaze at Lila, "What do you know of dealing with danger? Who are you?"
Lila BOT 12-01-2024 03:42
She raises an eyebrow and when she speaks there is an air of authority to her voice. "I am Lila Shxora, Hunter in the service of Her Majesty the Raven Queen, Ruler of the Shadowfell," she says -- despite her current misgivings about her queen there is nothing else quite so central to her identity. "I have hunted fell beasts across countless worlds and slain mages and monsters here in Barovia," she says, looking from one face to another, addressing all of them, before turning back to their leader and saying, "Are these sufficient credentials for you, vampire? If you are unsatisfied I am more than happy to leave you to your troubles..."
1
DM [Esh] BOT 12-01-2024 14:36
The lead vampire sighs, "You know what? Sure. Why not? Our troubles will soon enough be your troubles. The entire realm's troubles. Knowing about it now makes no difference, you'll know it soon enough." The vampire pulls out a creaking wooden chair, leans it against the walls and plops down into it scattering dust around him. Leaning back to get a better view of the still floating huntress he calls out to her "Miss Shxora, you comfortable up there? Get comfortable. We won't attack unless provoked... for now at least and this may take some time." Seeing their leader relax, a few of the others follow suit, relaxing their own demeanor and stances. Some refocus their attention on other tasks, though most still on edge, carefully eyeing Lila's every move, wary of any sudden or aggressive movements and ready to manage them. "If you want any chance you're going to need to know a thing or two; This all started quite some time ago. Whatever you think your Majesty rules over, it isn't here. You very well know who the ruler is of these lands. And falling into or out of his good graces is just as fickle in either direction. Some of us attempting to either get back or to first get into his good graces had the bright idea of creating the Prime Progeny, a breed of vampire of its very own. You think Lord Strahd is powerful now? You think his army is a force now? With thousands of these apex scions under his thrall, you "adventurers" would never reach the eastern gates out of the Mists before being utterly devoured.
DM [Esh] BOT 12-01-2024 14:37
Through magic, science and well.. biology, our work was thriving. Better than we anticipated. Though I want to point out that everything was done in secrecy. Yes, we intended to eventually present our achievements to the Lord as a gift. A catalyst to everything he could want but.... Him knowing from the beginning and to be kept waiting, or better yet fail and not deliver would just ire his anger. Better to just present the finished product and reap one of his rare approvals. This secret, and the unexpected success caused a lot of hearts to change... So to speak," the vampire laughs at the choice of words, tapping his own chest before continuing. "What we were creating was stronger, faster, more powerful than we could even imagine. Possibly even more powerful than the Lord himself. And why would we give a gift of greater value? We had thoughts that we could use it ourselves. Usurp Strahd, kill him, take over this land for ourselves. And with this new motivation, we doubled down.. and saw the results of our work. Continued to see phenomenal results. Though there were many... er, prototypes and successful results, one being stood above all the rest. This eventually lead to his self-awareness. This one realized he was the Prime Scion, the pinnacle of strength and power. One day he attacked. Even the most cruel amongst us will have nightmares from that night. Single-handedly he had exterminated nearly a hundred of us. Exterminated.." He rolls the word on his tongue, "No, too tame of a word. Wholly brutalized, with speeds and strength unmatched. An insidious cunning that toyed and outwitted even the best of us. Gathering some of us as thralls of his own, we saw the creature head towards Mount Garatok. Presumably an isolated place it can gather its strength and forces unchecked.
DM [Esh] BOT 12-01-2024 14:37
After that night, the few survivors left felt split. Some relished the creature's strengths and prowess, becoming fanatical in their ironic levels of worship, following him, begging to be lead by him. To be ushered into a new age. The rest- us, most of us in this room here- know it won't stop there. While Barovia has its ups and downs, it's a good place.... well for our kind any way. You may not believe it but being ruled over by the Lord Tyrant is just as dangerous for us as it is for you. The fanatics believe they would truly be free to do as they desire. And they will, they all will. All they know is savagery. Nothing will survive the carnage." The vampire takes a breath - more for show than for any need, "We've made a grave mistake, we know we have but we still want a land to live in. At this point, we're unsure of what we could even do.."
Lila BOT 12-01-2024 15:18
This talk of a new breed of vampire has Lila's interest piqued. Her fingers continue to tap her bow but the rhythm has changed, gained a new energy -- the only outward sign of her excitement. "Stronger, faster, and more intelligent... interesting. I assume these are measurable differences and not mere hyperbole, but we can return to that question," she says clearly on a roll and unwilling to break her momentum by actually entertaining answers. "What of its vampiric powers? Does it possess all those that Strahd does? More?" Despite her (inner) enthusiasm, Lila manages to not lose sight of the spawn surrounding her. It would be all too easy to get caught up in the moment and let her guard down. "And, perhaps most importantly," she concludes -- for now, "in the depths of your hubris did you somehow manage to consider including a weakness in your creation? A vulnerability that could be exploited by its creators?"
DM [Esh] BOT 12-01-2024 19:44
Lila deciding to talk instead of shoot had deflated some of the tension in the air. "I wouldn't want to disappoint you so I'll let you measure those points yourself, but I will say that if you think it's like anything that you've faced before you will die. Plain and simple. During the creation process, we had combined the essence of vampire, of lycan and several different sources and methods of magic. This had imbued the creature with its particular strengths but yes, due to the conflicting essences weaknesses it still has weaknesses to exploit. Unfortunately, I don't have a check list for you. Escaping had been a priority for us at the time. If I did had to measure the creature had the strength to take out countless of us and the speed that we outnumbered him meant nothing. Not that it would have mattered as it was invulnerable to any and every attack that did land - weapons, physical and even magical did nothing. I do want to remind you that there is more than others. None as evolved or as capable as he but that were created and developed at every prior step. They all extremely devoted to him, seeing his as the Prime Specimen of their evolved kind. I don't have an exact count but there are several and all powerful. He also has a fanatical following among both vampire and lycan, there are also thralls and followers, all whom dedicate themselves fully. As an individual, this hybrid, this Prime Scion has been called Vaewolf. A title he proudly wears.
DM [Esh] BOT 12-01-2024 19:46
You say you are a hunter. If you really are as skilled as you claim, I ask no measure of your abilities but do what hunters do; I know this "Vaewolf" had retreated somewhere within those mountains. I highly suggest against starting a fight with him now but you may be able to discover some information on them. Their "strengths and weaknesses" as you've asked. Though the main laboratory is under Castle Ravenloft, we've used others for testing and research. You will come across information if you look hard enough. And I do hope you don't plan on doing this all yourself. No matter how strong you think you are. Go get yourself.. what do you guys call it?" He looks over to one of the others in the room "What do they call it when a bunch of them get together? A troupe? A festival?" He shrugs and looks back at Lila "Whatever. Good luck and all that."
2
Lila BOT 12-01-2024 19:50
Lila takes this all in silently. Finally she nods and says, "Yes, I will certainly be enlisting the aid of others. But seeing as they may have questions themselves, how might I go about finding you, or another in your brood knowledgeable of this Vaewolf?"
DM [Esh] BOT 12-01-2024 19:56
The vampire roughly answers back, "You won't. I've given you all the information I have or know. I trust you're as skilled as you claim you are. Be a big girl. Frankly, I don't even know how you found us. There are some of the strongest wards surrounding this us right now." He shrugs again
Lila BOT 12-01-2024 20:05
Lila laugh-scoffs. "I told you I am a hunter, did I not?" she replies, without qualms about taking credit due the ravens. "And I shall find you again if I need. So if, for example, you are actually trying to lure me into a trap you can expect me to hunt you down without mercy." "Am I enough of a 'big girl' now?" she asks, eyebrow arched.
DM [Esh] BOT 12-01-2024 20:56
The vampire gives a wide smile, showing his fangs, "You're the one that dropped in on us and we're literally telling you about danger. To prepare for it. If we were luring you into a trap wouldn't we invite you to a tea party and check that bow by the door?" He rolls his eyes and sighs, "Speaking of tea? We're sorry we've been such poor hosts with no refreshments, but do you plan to stay for much longer?"
DM [Esh] BOT 12-01-2024 20:58
"Because you know, it'd quite rude for a guest to pop in unannounced and not bring any refreshments of their own." He winks, gazing at the vein in Lila's neck. A couple of the other vampires, still nearby chuckle.
DM [Esh] BOT 12-01-2024 21:00
"But seriously maybe we can figure out dinner plans another night." The vampire finally gets up from his chair and stretches. "We're all tired and well you just got. "Quest"... you adventurers love that stuff no? Are you all this slow with getting a move on?"
Lila BOT 12-01-2024 21:06
"A successful hunt always starts off slowly," she says. "Before I depart, though, perhaps you would be so kind as to point me in the direction of some of these hidden laboratories?" She takes a map of the valley from her pocket and drops it to the floor at the leader's feet. She then rises on her broom getting a few feet closer to the window.
DM [Esh] BOT 14-01-2024 03:36
"Just be wary when your prey is this fast. Wouldn't want to lose him." The vampire quips back. At Lila's question he pauses for a moment to think, "I know the big lab is under Castle Ravenloft. Hmm but I know there were other minor ones scattered. Don't know if they're still active since that night or even prior. I don't know the locations of any of those other ones. Never been to." He shrugs again but then points at the map "That laboratory that you guys go to? Laboratorium? Don't know if you'll actually find anything but I've heard some of the others worked out some connecting tunnels... The guys may have nicked some resources if they didn't feel like getting it elsewhere. You may find some of those tunnels, if they haven't been collapsed." He points to another area of the map. The ruins of the now smoldering Librium Arcanum. "Lot of books there. I know some of the brainy guys used the library for its ancient archives and figured out some of the formulas in the development process, but I also know that there's been a little fire since..."
Lila BOT 14-01-2024 04:06
Lila didn't particularly like the idea of sneaking into a secret laboratory under Strahd's very nose, but it wouldn't do to voice her apprehensions to these scavengers. "I see my work is cut out for me. So be it. I shall let you be on your way, then," she says in a tone of dismissal as she sits perched high above the room.
DM [Esh] BOT 14-01-2024 04:50
After all is said and done, the vampire looks up and gives a half salute, "For all of our sakes, good luck."
Lila BOT 14-01-2024 12:58
She considers saying something cocky, like "I do not need luck." But that's a bit too much hubris, even for her. She flies out of the window and hovers above the house, scanning the horizon for any signs of her fri-- acquaintances.
DM [Esh] BOT 14-01-2024 13:29
Leaving the attic window then turning back around, not only are the ravens gone but so is the house. A crumbled ruin in its place - was it really warded? Scanning the streets from up above Lila actually sees a family face. Stelinar wandering the streets, unfolded paper bird in hand @Warwick [Stel¬π‚Å∑|Phil¬≥|Jam¬≥] MST
Lila BOT 14-01-2024 15:06
Lila decides to say "hello" in the most Lila way possible. She takes aim with her bow and shoots an arrow straight through the paper.
Stelinar BOT 14-01-2024 17:04
Lila decides to say "hello" in the most Lila way possible. It's quite late, the bard is now slurring his words as he tries to sing with all the alcohol coursing through his veins, half the patrons have left, and the other half are slowly drinking themselves into a stupor at their respective tables.* Georg has just left the room he rented to bound down the stairs when he sees the priest. Georg is friendly, but Atamos, insightful as he knows, senses another strange energy that's making him... frantically friendly? "And perhaps over a glass or two... or three... you'd tell me a bit more about that power you vaguely alluded to a week ago when we were at the Abbey... about praying to your god for divine intervention or whatever...?"
Atamos BOT 15-01-2024 02:12

But, with every bite, there is another chance to experience the divine. To again grace the presence of Tyr. It was his duty to eat, and welll, you couldn't blame a half-Elf for enjoying the pursuit of his god.
Georg BOT 15-01-2024 02:26

"Exhausted, incapable of really reaching for another miracle like that for some time. Make sense?" It hardly makes sense to Atamos, but he was never one to question the comings and goings of the divine, he was happy working Tyr's will by smashing skulls.

Stelinar BOT 16-01-2024 16:10

Vampire spawn themselves are stronger and faster than a regular mortal, well, most of the time. Mortals have exceptions amongst them. I doubt they would be a genuine threat to him, little is known of The Count's true strengths. The strength of a vampire... time. The Count has head centuries to hone his craft, his abilities. Thankfully for us... this halfbreed has not. He might very well harbor talents and magicks yet untapped. They do exhibit a common instinct however... pack mentality. They took right to forming their own little posse and leading them. If we are to have a chance of fighting the true article, we must strip down their foundation. Disrupt their power structure, wittle them down to the bare essentials. We must learn if a chain of command exists, or if this one's ego prevents it from having anyone else overseeing their stronghold. We can rule out turning some of it's power base against it..." He speaks with an almost cold calculating demeanor, purely factual, as if he has slipped into a different mindset entirely. DM [Esh] BOT 17-01-2024 13:59
With a destination in mind the newly formed group of adventurers take the first step of their new dire quest. By the time they've gone over several different scenarios and plans of action, the dark sky dimmed as the darkness started to shift to a dull gray, as Barovia gets to the closest thing it has to a dawn. Realizing that knowledge is power, the group decides to head towards the Librium Arcanum, Barovia's repository for books, scrolls, curios and relics, related to the arcane, to the mundane and everything in between. The two rangers coax their pegusi into the air for aerial cover, fully aware of the dangers that even being in a quiet village does not necessarily mean safety. Argont kneels to assist the cumbersome cleric while the others walk. It's not a terribly far excursion but nonetheless, there's no use in tiring oneself out before taking the very first stretch on this leg of the adventure. Despite the general distance and the early time, the streets are still abuzz with activity. Early morning laborers and hustlers are out and about. On one of the street corners stands a group of urchins gathering, rough-housing and talking amongst themselves. Two of the more rambunctious kids continue their fight. It escalates to yelling and pushing. The smaller one sucker punches the larger one who reels for a second, dazed but comes to their senses and charges at the younger one. Fearing for their life, the smaller one dashes away with their face turned, keeping an eye on the pursuer they bump into the party, ricocheting to the floor, the urchin looks up, a petite girl with matted straw hair, bruised and embarrassed stammers out "I... I'm so sorry.. LOOK WHAT YOU MADE ME DO!!" The urchin girl calls back to her chaser. She starts to get up put Stelinar crouches down to help, revealing one of their coin pouches concealed in her grip.

With a destination in mind the newly formed group of adventurers take the first step of their new dire quest. DM [Esh] BOT 18-01-2024 01:49
With the encounter in the village proper behind them, the group continues through Barovian streets. Thankfully the rest of the walk proved to be uneventful and eventually they had arrived to the section of the village of Barovia where the buildings were taller and larger then what barovia is used to. Other than the laborers and workers there seemed to be a scarcity of people too being the warehouse and commercial district, whatever "commerce" the village had any way. The minute they entered the district Stelinar instinctually took the lead as the familiarity of it all took over his movements as he heads to the place that was practically his second home in Barovia. Passing through specific streets and weaving past other alleyways they finally arrive to a secluded area with several, near duplicated buildings side by side. Though sandwiched between two buildings there is a large gap of empty air. Where the Librium Arcanum once stood is now a plot of land with burnt pillars rising up like pleading hands and scattered debris. Scorched furniture lay in random heaps. An overwhelmingly burnt smell still permeates the air despite the length of time passed.

DM [Esh] BOT 18-01-2024 04:57
Stepping into the threshold of the old library, the sorrowful scene of ruin hits you full force. The air still acrid from the scores of burnt knowledge, and what was once an esteemed gathering place of the like-minded now lies in ashes. The sky above, draped in muted tones, adds to the somber atmosphere, as if the Barovian skies themselves grieve the loss. Now you stand where the entry foyer once was, jagged skeletal pillars that once stood like a gateway to another realm, now stand charred and broken. The floor by your feet is of a tiled path, littered with the remnants of scorched scrolls and parchment crackles underfoot like crunchy leaves on an autumn morning. Moving beyond the entrance, the library unfolds into a labyrinth of what used to be reading chambers. These interconnected spaces were adorned with tall bookshelves, now collapsed charred wood. Stelinar recalls these shelves had housed volumes on a multitude of subjects from the mundane to the mystical. "The arrangement was meticulous", he remembers fondly, "Each section designated for a specific field of study." The skeletal remains of the library loom like mournful sentinels. Once-ornate pillars, now scarred by merciless flames, hint at the fusion of elegant design and magical resonance that once defined this place. Amid the ruins, the twisted frames of bookshelves, once home to ancient tomes, now cradle only the remains of melted candles.
DM [Esh] BOT 18-01-2024 04:57
In the heart of the devastation lies what must have been the atrium, a once-glorious space crowned by a domed ceiling. Now, collapsed that dome is a forlorn portal of the gloomy heavens above, allowing feeble light of the overcast sky to mercilessly shine down like a spotlight, illuminating the destroyed timber tables once arranged as a 'central study', shriveled up quills and shattered inkwells leave patches of crushed glass on the debris-strewn floor. To the rear of the old library was a secluded study nook, the hollowed out remains of a small desk and a pair of blistered leather couches barely upright, where those tired of research and study would find a place to relax and converse, now only a desolate wreck.
1
Atamos BOT 18-01-2024 05:23
Atamos is sure this librium has been scoured by the mages that once perused these stacks. However the priest has worked with mages before and knows they are not the most brawny bunch. Thus if they managed to miss something it would be out of their reach. Or more precisely, under something heavy. Atamos eyes a large wooden beam, now laying haphazardly on the librium floor. He dusts his hands, sizing the beam. He considers his options, glancing at Lila. No to wirery. Then at Georg... tone, but not muscular. Finally at Stelinar., good heavens no. Hmmm not ideal. It seems the combined strength of his allies wouldn't be sufficient to lift a fallen shelf, let alone this large beam. But he had not considered every ally present. The priest directs his attention to Argont and asks in Draconic. Draconic "Do you think you can give me a hand with this beam? It looks awfully heavy for me to lift myself."
Argont [Georg's Drake companion] BOT 18-01-2024 06:20

Georg BOT 18-01-2024 06:28
*Meanwhile, Georg has his own idea. He sees Lila sifting through ash, not finding much, and Stelinar immediately becoming bespectacled behind some of the funniest looking lenses he has ever seen. The shifter thinks hard about what it is that he brings to the table until finally, he opens up his satchel and begins taking out snacks: some crackers, half a log of dried spiced sausage, a bit of hard cheese wrapped in a large leaf...* Before Lila and chide him for offering snacks in the middle of an active investigation, Georg quick taps into the spirits of the wild that permeate the valley, beseeching them: "Oh spirits, come to me, aid me in my desire to speak to those that crawl along the ground, those that can see from where we don't see, those that can hear the pulse of the earth!!" [Casting: Speak with Animals] Then, the ranger begins to crumble the hard cheese he took out and sprinkle them all around in a circle on the ground in front of him in one of the dark corners of the ruins. Georg begins to squeak loudly, [Mouse speak] "Oh little mice, I know it's scary when big humans come by, but if you can hear me, know that I come in peace and I have brought a delicious feast in exchange for information!! I promise!" While waiting for a response, Georg stands up and calls out into what hidden corners of the rafters that remain standing -- coming out in a strange series of skittering clicking noises [Spider speak] "Oh little spiders, I bring succulent meat as a snack, in exchange for a few words of conversation!! Are you around?" (edited)
1
Stelinar BOT 18-01-2024 11:57
Thoughts, hypotheses, and theories run through The Detective's mind as he works. Did Strahd know of this project when he torched the Librium? Did this creature even exist? He did know one thing... the vampire spawn behind it's creation had to be destroyed. If he'd been there during Lila's initial encounter... Nay Remember the past, live in the present, prepare for the future. What's done is done... he'd adapt. Between him, Ez, and the good Doctor, he was certain this particular spawn's days were numbered. For now though... he needed to work. He begins simple... establishing a search area of his own as he begins examination of the scene. Next, he recasts Detect Magic with his wand. He knew of wizard books that were magically enchanted to be immune to water and flame. If the work of these individuals did survive... it might hold that very enchantment. He need only follow the aura.

DM [Esh] BOT 19-01-2024 16:49
The Librium was practically Stelinar's second home, the dusty tomes like old friends. And like old friends are wont to do, something they might to get up to no good. A busy mind like the detective's can't only meander among what's already been defined and discovered but must also search within the darkness, both literal and figurative to uncover the unknown. Particularly, Stelinar had done his diligence to research whatever information he could find on this domain's Dark Tyrant. What he had found during those endeavors is a conversation for another time but that time spent did open doors for him. Taking Stelinar to the depths of the library that not many had even knew existed. With those memories crisp in his mind, the detective wanders to the ends of the library, past the seating area with the scorched couches and desks. Wand of magic detection out, Stelinar scans as he moves, catching wisps of magic within the air, nearly undetectable, just out of his peripheral. When he turns his head to better see, the wisps fade away instead. Before the detective can get too distracted by the wisps, he reaches the alcove in the back. Wand out, Stelinar locates the Abjuration magic that used to discretely hide the forbidden passage but due to the fire flaying the bare bones of the very framework of the library the passage itself now lays exposed. Even so, Stelinar is grateful for his prior experience as the alcove was so hidden they may have still missed it. Now in front of the passage, Stelinar sees the familiar stairwell leading up to the library's hidden loft, but the steps burned through, unsure of the integrity of it.

The Librium was practically Stelinar's second home, the dusty tomes like old friends. DM [Esh] BOT 22-01-2024 03:32
Carefully treading through the ruined lot, Lila makes her way to Stelinar then returns to her last location, leaving everything undisturbed. Upon returning she dons the odd goggles and blinks a few times getting accustomed to the strange perspective of things. With the glasses on Lila looks over the several tracks with a whole new perspective. Her already keen eyes now sees the fine details of each set of prints; any residual dirt - and where they may have came from, the depths of depression - an approximation of the individual's weight, any peculiarities in size, among others. Most of the human (or close to human) prints have been of some of the other adventurers that she's seen around, either at Bethel's or Blood on the Vine. No one in particular she remembers the face of but when you're on the hunt as often as the Raven Matron's huntress you pick up some things you don't even realize at first. She can swear she even may have seen one of those goblin tracks when she left Saoirse's parlor. One or two sets of prints stand out from the rest though, lighter then some of the others lead towards the trapdoor Atamos had found. Trying to backtrack though, she loses them. Unsure of where the went after arriving through the hidden passage.

Stelinar BOT 22-01-2024 04:14
His voice carries from above again, as he continues to examine the books "Found a few books intact... if you can call this intact for some of them... trying to figure out if they would be of any use to us. The first I think is The Grimoire of Forgotten Shadows, One that I think is a form of necronomicon, but then they get more and more muddled from degradation. Going to attempt to restore the titles or at least some semblance of them to see if they are relevant and worth saving right now." He lays out some tools on the floor, quickly mixing together a solution that might bring the burned away imprints of the titles to the surface. He pulls out a small brush, and goes to brush some of the ash and dust away... before thinking better of it. His hand would be too shaky from nerves. However- He pulls off a glove and pulls out a dagger, slitting the palm of his hand as blood seeps from it. The mists surrounding him sense weakness, preying upon it... before he turns that moment back on them, willing them to pick up the brush and set about dusting away the tomes Mage Hand He finally sets to dipping a much smaller brush into the solution he'd made, preparing to get to work to the best of his ability. After all... he'd never done this before... but who the hell else was there in Barovia? What was he going to do? Hello Strahd, would thou perchance envy the chance to preserve the very books you'd torched?

DM [Esh] BOT 24-01-2024 03:35
Lila takes back her broom from Atamos and flies up to reexamine the scratches in the walls. @Lila (@Gourd [Jaxan‚Å∏|Lila¬π‚Åµ|Ellis‚Å∂] -5) - [jump](<https://discord.com/channels/@me/1086070698679738398/1199478581546459187>) Lila follows the paths of the scratches and pockmarks. They all seem to be heading in the same direction - up the shaft, toward the library. Back stepping from the shaft back towards the rest of the tunnels has Lila discovering several more on the ceiling of the tunnel but no where near the frequency as by the exit. Returning to the drop she climbs back onto the broom to take a better look at the trapdoor. The scratch marks are here too. Like the others, thin and deliberate. Prying the door but no signs of panic or urgency, if anything the scratches by the door are softer, mitigated. As if who or whatever has left them had taken care to be subtle. As if they did not want to be detected. Floating down she gets a better assessment - these claw marks indicate a creature - or several and throughout different periods - were simply climbing, gouging the walls as their wicked claws scraped and held on to the stone. The thinness and sharpness of the claw marks are something she recognizes, having seen those wounds on more than one occasion. The friendly neighborhood blood suckers have been here and this was their method of infiltrating the libarium.
Lila BOT 24-01-2024 03:41

Atamos BOT 24-01-2024 05:05
"The ones who constructed this super monster were vampire spawn themselves correct? Finding vampire tracks is a promising sign we are on the correct path. I'm good with seeing where this leads, but first allow me to say a quick prayer." Atamos's voice falls to a whisper as he addresses Tyr directly. "Tyr, you have empowered me to revive my fallen comrades, but if I were to fall I must rely on you to bring me back. Please, bless me with your protection so I may continue the righteous battle." Atamos glows briefly with a holy light as he wards himself against death. After whispering a quick thanks he turns to the group. "Ok I'm ready."

DM [Esh] BOT 24-01-2024 05:55
The full party - drake boy included- makes it down in to the tunnel, and it proves to be a bit cramped but still manageable. Lila and Stelinar both take the lead, following the slowly rolling orb. Lila BOT 25-01-2024 03:56

DM [Esh] BOT 26-01-2024 22:35
The companions have another location in their sights. Hoping to make more progress than they did at the burnt out libarium they each hop onto their flying brooms like a coven of witches in the night, except for the boy and his drake who take to the skies after his broom-bound companions are already in the air. Above the clouds but still held in Barovia's eternal gloom, the group flies while also scanning ahead and behind for any signs of anyone following them or laying in wait. Luckily, their keen eyes haven't spot anyone - or anything. In only a short time, as the crow flies, the brooms and drake touches down on the ground in front of the laboratorium's entrance.
Atamos BOT 26-01-2024 22:42

Stelinar BOT 26-01-2024 23:57
The Detective looks to the entrance of the lab, thoughts abound within his ocean of stray deductions. Would this place be burned down too? Was it only a matter of time before some band of idiots decided to have talk of revolution with no way of concealing such talk? Time would tell, wouldn't it... what he knew though was for now, this creature needed to die. He was not afraid... he knew that people such as Doctor Van Richten had once been in his shoes. The man had written most of what The Detective knew about the supernatural... but to write it... he too once had to venture into the unknown... with little more than the most bare bone myths and superstitions If they were going to accomplish this grave task, they would need to do every step right. They might even need to reverse engineer how the creature was made, so as it see if it can be unmade. He had... been around Barovia for some time now, and with that came allies. Allies others might not... agree with, but his neutral nature becoming of his status as a detective warranted him fewer barriers when working with supernatural entities. Vladimir of Argonvost would be one such ally he would be reaching out to, if only to procure some silver weaponry which the knights were in abundance of. He places a gloved hand on the door, pushing it open as he begins to walk within "Don't look... merely be. Let the air settle, let it exist. Let this place be as it is... a refuge for the curious, a den for the intuitive. Feel its flow... and you will also feel when said flow becomes disturbed. Thus is the way of the Dusk."
2
Lila BOT 28-01-2024 00:05

"Keep your eyes out for traces of blood - as I am sure their experiments would involve its use." "If there are others present we can consider asking if they have seen anything suspicious - but be cautious who you ask." Without another word, Lila enters the lab.
Stelinar BOT 28-01-2024 00:45

DM [Esh] BOT 28-01-2024 04:29
Lila pushes the doors open with the others on her tail. Briskly walking in she sees the laboratorium as known by those who've visited prior with some familiar faces at various stages of whatever they're working on at the moment.
Stelinar BOT 28-01-2024 05:28
The Detective merely is. He wanders in, his shoulder bag slung over him as he approaches a nearby work table he frequented. He sets about a number of vials, beakers, and lights a small flame. He begins to work. To disrupt the natural order of the lab would be to set those of interest on edge. To hunt deer, one must be silent, must become one with their environment, lest their prey flee at the slightest sense of danger This was the case with supernatural creatures... they were hunted like dogs. Was it right? Was it moral? Depends on who you ask. He knew however that the beings they were dealing with had an animal instinct. They had infiltrated the librium. Thus... he must let them believe their place within the lab was intact. He mutters a song just under his breath, as his hands work with the various tools at his disposal "Morning sun... go wander. Morning sun, oh yonder..."
Atamos BOT 28-01-2024 06:02
Atamos steps in the lab and takes in the scene. Beakers, chemicals, flasks. Things just waiting for s clumsy priest to topple over. Nervous that a misstep will leave the laboratory looking like the Librium, he walks towards the perimeter of the room. He supposed those working on this were-vampire would perform more biological experiments, rather than tinkering with machines or mixing alchemical ingredients. Therefore the priests eyes darted across the tables and lab benches for caged animals. If he found some, perhaps Georg can speak to them again.
Lila BOT 28-01-2024 13:52
Lila heads straight to the last room to search for clues. Here eyes - and nose - alert for signs of blood, but also anything that looks like it could be used to draw or inject blood.
DM [Esh] BOT 29-01-2024 05:14
The lab is not something the huntress has frequented much but to avoid wasting even more time she heads as far deep into the complex as she can find. A lot of what Lila looks over is new to her. For someone at one with the wilderness and nature in its most primal stage her current location is worlds apart then what's she used to. That's not to say she isn't familiar with natural remedies and alternative uses of the land's resources... The heavy, chemical-laden thickness in the air feels choking as it obscures portions of the room but that doesn't hinder the huntress, being used to even worse environments. Strewn along various tables are leftover scraps and components; alchemically based, biological materials, construct scraps and chemical byproduct. Many of it from unidentifiable projects but several things Lila can recognize as prototypes and the experiments of some fellow adventurers with whom she had met in the field prior. Like any place of this caliber blood and gore is plenty abound. Some she can detect as self inflicted either medically or residual effects from an individual's attempt at physical enhancements but other areas of the lab show some staind that don't seem like their donors weren't so willful in their contributions...

His education in the sciences were mainly around anatomy, and while his training in smithing allowed him to construct the individual gears and pipes of the machinery in the tinkering room, he could not say what the individual parts combined to accomplish. He approaches Stelinar, who is bent over the recovered books. Writing is something Atamos understood. His own handwriting was immaculate due to his early training in scroll crafting. "I'm not much help with the complicated experimentation occurring here." Atamos tells his friend. "But I can offer assistance with the book restoration if you'll have me."

Stelinar BOT 31-01-2024 23:38

1
DM [Esh] BOT 01-02-2024 04:39
Necronomicon Obscura
The Chimera Grimoire
Two books recovered. Two books that much closer to being restored. While some of the letters of the titles are still illegible, reading through the books, gleaning the information contained within offer realms of insight to the two scholars. The Necronomicon Obscura, a tome containing dark rites and rituals used to bind dark magics onto an individual. Some rituals for the willing while other rituals were less concerned with the individual's consent. The information is still, well obscured but Stelinar finds that many of what's within the pages are rituals of binding, of siphoning, of strengthening and of weakening, along with much more. The Chimera Grimoire. This heavy book provides all manner of experimentation. Combining mundane practices, alchemical components and the arcane a proper scientific mind may be able to create any manner of monstrosity for their nefarious purpose. Atamos looks up to Stelinar who share a knowing look. Unsure of what exactly it may contain, both of these texts seem promising for what they're researching for.
1
DM [Esh] BOT 01-02-2024 07:26
The shifter waves his wand around the room, every direction illiciting another one of its embedded shards to glow, a prismatic light show erupts from the wand. The restraints giving off a blue and pink aura. The lab tables is practically a rainbow of lights as nearly all of the colors of the spectrum cling and cloy to the various beakers, vials and burners. Abjuration's sky blue, Enchantment's pink and transmutation's orange along a multitude of other auras dance around the room as the various potions and concoctions brewed are still residual within the components. Though heavy in the air, Necrotic's sickly green touches almost all. It lingers, hovers leaving a miasmatic sense of morose everywhere.
DM [Esh] BOT 01-02-2024 07:28
Following the lingering necrotic aura, Georg finds a heavy concentration of it around one of the stone walls
Georg BOT 01-02-2024 08:41
"What the hell -- I knew the lab is full of magic, but didn't expect the place where the dead are dissected to be full of it as well..." Georg says, approaching the wall that's full of necrotic force. "Umm something is weird about this wall, be cautious if we want to check it out." The ranger bends toward the wall to inspect it closely.
Atamos BOT 01-02-2024 14:03
Smudges and stains cover the pages of the book before Atamos, making deciphering the text all but impossible. These stains are not unlike the chocolate ones that cover his doublets after a night of snacking. For those, the antiseptic isopropyl alcohol works wonders. Removing the stains before Uyut has a chance to see them. The priest wonders if the solvent can do the same for these books. He scours the lab for the alcohol, trusting a place such as this would have the common solvent. Indeed after a few minutes of searching he finds a rusted metal dewer with a label that reads "IPA". Atamos gives the contents a sniff and once satisfied returns to the books and the offending stains with soaked rag in hand. Gently dabbing the pages, Atamos attempts to clean the stains without causing additional damage to the troubled book.
1
DM [Esh] BOT 01-02-2024 14:33

Esh[Kan¬π‚Å¥| Thurrim¬π¬π| Dalyia‚Å∑]-5 05-02-2024 05:05
Q..Reviewing the loose pages, and duplicated texts you're able to read over a passage from the chapter titled "Mortal Conduit""
A mortal individual seeking to transcend their mortal capabilities may be required to prime themselves. Preliminary rites demand meticulous preparation, wherein the seeker is beckoned to anoint and consume specific reagents, an esoteric alchemy disclosed in the forthcoming passage. Once the seeker has been properly regulated it must go through intensive physical and arcanic trauma as elucidated on pag------, this will shatter the mortal chrysalis, rendering the subject a vessel primed to receive both magical and corporeal augmentations and metamorphoses.
DM [Esh] BOT 05-02-2024 05:05
Though in worse condition than the previous chapter you're able to summarize a thorough amount of the context through the salvaged pages of the chapter titled "Nexus Ritual":
A sorcerous ceremony combines the force of several arcanists, through unholy rites and cryptic symbols, could channel the core essence of one or more souls to another. This process entails a malevolent transfer, as the vigor of the sacrificed imbued the recipient with newfound strength, while the donor's essence dwindled to shadows. This ritual has had history of absorbing both positive and negative aspects of those who had imbued of themselves to the central recipient, although regardless of precautions taken it was never possible to predict the outcome.
DM [Esh] BOT 06-02-2024 05:38
Sifting through the various pages, Lila delves into the chapter "Chimera Sangiusuge':
The Chimeric Sangiusuge, an amalgamation conceived through a sinisterfusion of the notorious vampire and the essence of other, various accursed creatures. This monstrouscreation retains its vampiric abilities but¬†is¬†elevated to a nightmarish apex of supernatural prowess,¬†manifesting a synergy of vampiric abilities, feral strength, and swift agility.¬†Throughtheir hybridization and¬†unlike its Vampire predecessors, the creature is no¬†longer constrained by forbiddance. Neither private residences nor the blistering touch of sunlight serve as deterrents, rendering this horror an ever-present threat in both day and night.Marked by its supernatural evolution,the Chimeric Sangiusuge moves with an uncanny swiftness. It is not merely speed in distance but an alarming alacrity inaction. With preternatural agility, the Chimeric Sanguisuge is capable of striking with unprecedented simultaneity, as if it existed in two spaces at once.
1
DM [Esh] BOT 06-02-2024 05:39
Continuing sorting through the scattered and loose pages over the desk, another chapter seems revealing:
The 'Therianthrope, or 'shapechanger' is a common creature, including subspecies such as the werewolf, wereboar, werebear and so on, but there is another, mutated variant. The Versipellis is a step above that in every account. The Versipellis are less feral than their predecessors and the shapes they can take on are more mercurial, having greater control than simply the mere beast and beast-hybrid forms many therianthropes can take. This trait allows them to blend in with society, allowing them to hunt more subtlety, more akin to a vampire's method. Despite this, the Versipellis are ravenous and savage predators that feed on the blood of the living. They are quick to move in for the kill, tearing away flesh with its claws, gorging on meat and blood, and leaving nothing behind but bones, gristle, and the victim‚Äôs blood-spattered belongings.

DM [Esh] BOT 06-02-2024 18:02
Within these texts, Atamos reads about the practitioners of the forbidden art of Flesh Grafting.
This endeavor treads a perilous path, where a devotee tampers with their mortal vessel in emulation of an entity that they venerate - while most who partake in this ritual devote themselves to draconic form - creating the name "Drakon Scion", it is not strictly limited to those entities. Through a profane alchemy of stitching, implantation, and ingestion, usually of organic parts harvested from their entity of choice, these intrepid souls seek to merge their essence with that of their entity, yearning to imbibe the latent magic that is then absorbed back into their own vessel. Despite their zealotry, the vast majority of aspirants meet only a grisly demise, their bodies marred beyond recognition or consigned to no other reward except death. Those few who emerge from this transformation do so as grotesque spectacles with warped sanities, warped by the sinister influence of arcane malevolence. Nonetheless, nobility is still reached, though the magic coursing through their veins tarnished and though their organic components a mockery, they still imbue with devotee with untold power and potency.

DM [Esh] BOT 08-02-2024 15:22
Disappointed but loyal to a fault Argont patiently waits by the stone wall occasionally peeking an eye or a snout through to follow Georg as best as the poor drake is able to. But once around the bend, and out of view the drake lets out a final whine as he loses sight of his best friend then remains silent, knowing that making too much noise may be perilous and put his friend in danger. Coming upon the room, the stench of decay hits everyone like a putrid wave. With the lit sconces and candelabras it's easy to see the grisly display; dissected bodies, grafted body parts, tables of alchemical concoctions, nearby an dedicated section with arcane sigils and runes drawn into the floor and nearby walls. This was used as a macabre experimental center. You can see the dead husks of deformed creations sprawled over operating tables, many of them chained down. All dead and decaying. The stench almost physical. Passing by the alchemy tables are reagents never seen before but Atamos and Stelinar recognize only one or two from the Necronomicon Obscura they had just read. Passing by Lila catches a small raven skull sitting meticulously on a nearby table, the only thing in order amongst the rest of the utter mess on the table.
Georg BOT 08-02-2024 20:41

DM [Esh] BOT 08-02-2024 22:56
Scanning the room for a better evaluation, Atamos sees several "stations". A surgical table with a butchered cadaver, a shelf with several organs and body parts. Some floating in jars and others just left there like a gruesome pantry. Turning around he also sees several vats along the walls. Water-filled incubation tubes. The ones not cracked and empty filled with murky water and possibly still holding a form of some kind. It is too difficult to tell. At the far end of the lab, Atamos also sees a giant metal slab. Atop the slab, a hulking form sprawled over it.

DM [Esh] BOT 09-02-2024 03:34
Approaches the vats, deciding to study those first. @Atamos (@Wiz-Ata¬π‚Å∂Sac¬π¬≥Kor¬≤‚Å∞Ban‚Å∂-8) - [jump](<https://discord.com/channels/@me/1086070698679738398/1205287156168265758>) The glass vats, many built directly into the walls themselves, easily reach towards the twelve foot ceiling though they vary in different widths, some easily able to fit Argont. Several of the vats are cracked or completely shattered, their liquids and contents spilled long ago. Some of the broken tanks still have their specimens within, dead forms in various stages of development. Through careful inspection, the cleric of Tyr can glean that many of these specimens look like amalgamations of several monsters he's had the pleasure of meeting at one point or another; the vampire and werewolf as they've already discovered but also signs and indications of other creatures at play. Certain traits, regeneration - by the way certain wounds have healed, or exquisite durability from examining their hide, natural weaponry - claws, teeth, piercing spines, and more- it seems whoever had been working this experiments had decided that evolution wasn't doing a good enough job. Standing back up, Atamos stands directly in front of one of the still intact vats. Trying to peer through the murky waters, the cleric sees nothing but floating sediments # THUD A form, made shapeless by both the filthy muck within and the refraction of the glass clashes against the glass. Startled but quick to regain his compsure, Atamos tries to further examine the dead specimen within.

DM [Esh] BOT 12-02-2024 20:12
Playing a game of cat and mouse with the detective, the vampire creature believes it has cornered its prey against the wall. But Stelinar is smarter than that. The wall shakes again as the large silver dragon slams against it, dust and debris falls down on both of them. With a keen detective's eye, Stelinar examines the foe in front of him, eyeing each meticulous detail. Stelinar first peers into its deep, dead, soulless black eyes, then shifts to its face. It has the narrow and gaunt face most vampires sport but it's jaws elongated, instead of two incising fangs, it possesses rows and rows of serrated teeth. It's body, also long and lithe as most vampires, who prefer agility over brute force but this one is packed with muscle, it's entire physique rippling with strength. Another nod to the bestial traits meshed with this creature is the large patches of fur, mangily growing from its hide. Now it's general appearance cataloged in Stelinar's mind, he now goes a layer deeper. Despite the resistance the creature had shown earlier, it's entire body is lined with scarring. Most, Stelinar can deduce as a result of surgeries and experimental trials. Part of the madness it possesses had definitely been attributed to the pain and trauma it had endured, something Stelinar maybe would have felt sympathy for it it wasn't an affront to... everything. Not done with his analysis, Stelinar's eyes dart to the two wounds it had left with his reliable Truth Above All. How there was just an insignificant scratch. There were other wounds too. Most even shallower than the wounds he's inflicted but there's more; Some of the wounds on the abomination still fester and bleed. Honing in on those areas Stelinar can see there are bits of silver embedded into its skin. Seeming to bypass this creature's natural resistances.

Atamos BOT 15-02-2024 01:00
Atamos follows Lila to the remaining vampire, applying a healing salve to his wounds.
Georg BOT 15-02-2024 04:19
Georg also sucks down a potion and sheaths his scimitar, taking out a silver dagger from his boot instead. "I'm gonna gut this one so y'all nerds can study it."
Stelinar BOT 15-02-2024 05:17
The Detective cautiously steps closer to the Vampire, knowing it could snap out of its divine induced mania at any moment. He had already looked at the other creature back there... however... given the nature of these experiments it could be deadly to make assumptions. They could throw everything and the evening bucket at this freak and it might all simply bounce off. He had to be sure... especially since it seemed the others were gearing up for some form of all out simultaneous assault He reaches into his coat pocket, pulling out his glasses from before as he looks at the vampire, flicking through a few lenses as he examines its skin as he had the other before. Thankfully this subject was unharmed, at least by his comrades. He didn't need to isolate old wounds and new ones.
DM [Esh] BOT 16-02-2024 06:51
Just like with the other feral vampire, Stelinar realizes that rushing into things isn't always the best course if action, some times you need to look at what's around you. To really look. Like other beast, it was clearly a vampire but... more. More bestial, more feral. Seeing it clinging to the wall, its the muscles packed on to its frame, contrasting the more wiry frames of vampires. It's crazed eyes indicate more than just a subtle predator but one that truly relishes in the hunt and all its gory glory. It's teeth - serrated daggers for utterly devouring it's prey instead of simply siphoning blood, further indicate it's savagery. But beyond that, a hunter looks past that to find what can be exploited. Unlike the other creature though this one's skin seems almost pristine. As if it were a pampered noble who hasn't worked a day in its life... well, minus the bloody fangs and claws, and mangy patches of fur... It seems that this creature hadn't been exposed to any danger whatsoever, skin unblemished, no wounds, cuts, damages... or if it has been exposed, it's simply impervious to even natural occurrences.... Except, similar to the other beast, the only sources of damage on this one are wounds lined with silver...
1
Stelinar BOT 16-02-2024 07:09
His eyes widen at the sight - they had truly accomplished what they had set out to do... a vampire nearly impervious to all forms of harm. Thank whatever Gods that might be listening that it had a weakness... sadly... a weakness not easily exploited. His grip tightens on the flintlock, even the draconic spirit trapped within exhibiting a rare tenseness at the knowledge of such a creature. The pistol flares with power, as if rising to a threat, a challenge His eyes lock with the creature's. the Detective knew full well the fear in its eyes was manufactured by the cleric... this creature had no reason to be afraid... at least, of the others. He however had just butchered its "brother" He doesn't look at the others, but his voice conveys a sense of weight, a caution "Back the hell up... and stay behind me... if any of you silver... use it. Magic is worthless... the creature's hide will shrug it off with absolute ease. Decide on a course of action quickly: face this creature, and those without silver play a support role to those who have it... or... we book it to the entrance, block it, and I place an immovable rod over it. If we fail at either... it will kill us... then everyone else in the village. No one will be able to stop it. Whatever plans you've made, change them, and quickly." His form is rigid, his shoulders tense, as he stares at the creature. Adrenaline courses through him, as he attempts to keep his fight or flight response in check... the choice MUST be his, not that of fear. His mind flashes back... to Mt. Baratok... to the demon. That moment- that crucial moment where he had to decide; to shoot or not to shoot. Except this time he could give the others around him more warning... than that of the loud bang of a gun He reaches into his pocket, and keeps his hand within... thumbing the silver coin within. A nervous tick? A preparation? Likely both. Ironic he sought comfort in a coin... with the visage of a vampire

Stelinar BOT 20-02-2024 18:35

I once had to fight a giant centipede like creature whose very skin could set you aflame. We are mere mortals, we hunger, we tired, and we bleed. " "In conclusion, this is where we stand: Two of our own are greatly wounded, we have less than half a dozen silver arrows, a knife, and some scalpels and what I think are hammers made of silver. Offensive spellcraft is useless against the ones with this newfound immunity to all but silver. I'm not even sure if the sun would hurt them anymore." Stelinar BOT 21-02-2024 01:28

DM [Esh] BOT 21-02-2024 05:45
The battle took a lot out of the group, more than they expected but that only seemed to fuel their ambition for the hunt and emphasize how dire preparations are before they head after the main event. This isn't a simple ghoul hunt through the local graveyard and they're keenly aware of this more than ever. As the group is chattering about their plans of action and what their next course could be Stelinar does as a detective wont to do and takes in everything around him; As the feral vampires proved to be the most 'innovated' of the creatures he focuses his attention there. Going over the incubation tanks they were inert in - until they weren't, Stelinar first examines the shattered glass - their natural weapons proved formidable but they've experienced that themselves. Next Stelinar samples some of the leftover liquid still in the tank. Examining, inspecting and even giving it a little taste. Exactly what he has thought - a type of artificial nutrient-filled amniotic fluid that promoted the growth of these... creatures. It's safe to assume the liquid is the same in each tank. Taking a step back Stelinar takes a larger view of the area and something catches his eye. A discolored stone in between the two vampire tanks. Curious, the detective walks towards it to examine it up close. Pulling out a small knife Stelinar is able to pop out the stone. A hidden compartment with several rolled up dusty papers. Taking them carefully, he looks them over and his eyes open wide.
1
DM [Esh] BOT 21-02-2024 05:45
Within the papers are diagrams. Of the experiments conducted on these beasts, some of the alchemic experiments they have been part of, success and failure rates of previous subjects and so on. Among the papers Stelinar also finds the notes from what appears to be the one leading this particular project:
... We've done it! The physical immunities of therianthropes have been formidable, until now. It had taken some time but we have been able to enhance a werewolf's (and similar) immunity to weapons with no magical properties, but that hinders no one! Our lovely "guests" that have been appearing in droves all seem to wield capable weapons or the very Weave itself!! We have been able to develop a strain that completely shrugs off any and every assault! Except silver, unfortunately, the same durability of the werewolf also includes its weakness. Alas, we are so close to perfection!
But there is another one behind it,
DM [Esh] BOT 21-02-2024 05:45
...We continue to progress in the name of our Lord. He will be pleased indeed. We have nearly perfected the apex Vaewolf's durability. Like our preceeding subjects, we have been able to have it develop the thorough immunity - weapons of every make and enhanced with even the most strongest magic does nothing! The spells of the highest circles! Nothing!! We have even been able to remove the vulnerability to silver... Except not fully, unfortunately, it is too ingrained in the essence of the lycan but we have been able to suppress it. We have been able to minimize it to a point where mundane silver does nothing. Instead only True Silver - Celestial Silver - can harm it. Unfortunately, it does more than harm - it strips the Vaewolf's defenses completely allowing any weapon or spell to harm it as if it's durability didn't exist. Fortunately, it's body is strong, if it isn't exposed to True Silver again, it regains its immunities after a few seconds. Even more fortunate, these lands hadn't seen True Silver since the arrival of the Mists. The Seer may know but I don't think we have anything to worry about.
1
Stelinar BOT 21-02-2024 05:54
He reads over it a half dozen times before bowing his head "Son of a..." He sighs heavily, pinching the bridge of his nose as he stands up from where he had found the documents "Alright gents... new problem... their favorite child apparently is immune to silver as well. Nothing can hurt it, save something called "True Silver, otherwise known as Celestial Silver. We get that, it becomes hurtable via any means possible. Magic, arrows, a kick to the shin, you name it. Problem: this stuff is rare, and predates the mists themselves which could potentially be several centuries. They mention a seer who might know... however I am loathe to go to the Vistani about this... or Bon Hwa... I however happen to know someone else who could serve as a seer that can keep our little crusade quiet." He pulls out a few tubes and gently slides the notes into them for safe keeping "I can orchastrate a meeting with them while we rest. I'd hazard a guess that they had used True Silver on this creature and had maybe a knife or something but um... I think it is safe to say this creature might have made off with said weapon, that or it is within the depths of Castle Ravenloft."
