Georg BOT 22-02-2024 11:41
"Sorry drake boy... will you carry me to Vallaki before I let you bed down and rest? These eager beavers really want to see a blacksmith right away." Georg pats the wounded drake gently in consolation, who grumbles a bit but accepts the course of action. The ranger jumps on the Drake's back and takes off into the sky after Lila.
DM [Esh] BOT 22-02-2024 14:28
Finding as much as they are going to, the group decides that the next course of action is to prepare themselves. Despite learning that the apex hunter itself isn't bothered by silver, it's followers may very well be and so they set their course. Leaving the secret laboratory and the laboratorium as a whole had been easy enough. Their blood and wounds had attracted some eyeballs but weirder things than that have happened within these walls and so they've quickly returned to their own work. Returning to street level the cool air is a refreshing difference compared to the stale stench of decay and experiments gone wrong. A sizeable chunk of time had passed since they've first arrived at the lab roughly in the afternoon. Several hours of restoring the book and then discovering the secret lab and the experiments and it's now late in the evening, the gloomy Barovian sky even darker and gloomier. Confirming again amongst themselves that the next course of action is to check out the forge in Vallaki in order to try to get their equipment silvered, they prepare for travel. As if on some sort of strange synchronized aerial team, each of our heroes pull out their own flying broom and mount it - all except Georg who prefers the majestic flight of his drake companion.
DM [Esh] BOT 22-02-2024 14:28
Kicking off, they each make it airborne but keep to the same height to travel together, as they are all keenly aware that even at these heights, Barovia is never truly a safe. Flying over the lands with an aerial view is a sight to behold! Even in a dismal and dreary land there's just something about seeing the world from this perspective... But it didn't last long. The clouds started to thicken, obscuring their view, not only of the ground below but it's become difficult to make out each other. Winds start to whip up, sending them off course. Atamos, despite his portly frame or maybe even because of it, remains as steady as if he were on the ground, maneuvering through the winds with ease. Following the updrafts, Stelinar is also able to properly maneuver himself but Lila, Georg and Argont are blown off balanced. Still feeling the weariness of the previous battle and never getting proper rest Lila's nearly knocked over but quickly rights herself before anything serious occurs though she is a little dizzy from the minor tumble. Argont, barely standing after being battered and wounded, and Georg in only barely better shape himself both start to drift off from tiredness. Compounded with the buffeting winds and obscuring Mists and Argont's wing buckles. The drake and his rider fall into a tailspin, losing altitude and quickly! Seeing their companion starting to plummet, they all rush to Georg and Argont's aid but how they are to help a couple-thousand pound creature remain in the air they haven't a clue! But luckily no one needed to find out, quickly regaining his positioning, Argont rights himself, catching the updraft and returning back to his companions' altitude. Having the wind knocked out of them, so to speak, only amplified how tired they were but before they even knew it, Vallaki appeared in view below them. After a smooth descent, the group touches down right outside the Vallaki gates.

Georg BOT 22-02-2024 20:16
"Thank you, Stel, for your continued generosity. But I can actually refresh Drake's physical form with only a tiny amount of my own mental energies instead of digging into your reserves." Georg smiles. He pats the drake's current form on the head with a gentle hand. "Thanks for your contributions so far, handsome. Let me give you a new form." The ranger closes his eyes and takes in a deep breath. As he does so, the drake's current form shimmers and begins to disintegrate and fade until he's gone. The ornate saddle that looks to be elven-made falls on the ground, as well as a little simple scarf with some magical runes sewn into it that the drake was wearing around his neck. In the same spot, a few seconds later, a new form is materializing and sprouting. The air around Georg is ever slightly chillier -- as a new silver dragon form appears without any wounds or scrapes, eyes bright and happy to see everyone as usual. "There. All better!" Georg helps Argont puts on the saddle again, strapping it on, as wel as tying the fallen scarf back around his neck. "Handsomest boy in all the realm."

Atamos BOT 23-02-2024 17:03

Lila BOT 23-02-2024 17:11

Georg BOT 23-02-2024 17:24
"You can do that!? What is it with priests and being good at working with metal? Haha." Georg unsheathes his darksteel and hands it to Atamos. "May Tyr's hammer strike true!"
Atamos BOT 23-02-2024 22:35
"I can, part of my training as a war cleric, long before coming to these lands." He finds it harder and harder to recall his life from before. Shaking his head he says. "Let me get started." Atamos starts the smithing, falling into the familiar rhythm of the work. The metal becoming the medium for his art. Too hot to touch with one's hands, Atamos must control the flow of it with his smith's tools as it coats Georg's scimitar. Too much can throw off the balance of the blade. Too little can expose the iron underneath. Atamos heats and pounds loosing himself in the work.
1
Stelinar BOT 23-02-2024 22:38
He waits for Atamos to finish melting down the silver, working on the bullets themselves. They are simple things, deceptively so. Weight, size, and shape mattered in how straight the bullet would fly. With the addition to silver coating, they would need to be a bit smaller so the coat does not weigh the bullet down too much. He pulls out a hammer of his own, working the small pieces of metal and working to smooth them into their shape "We are fortunate to be as self sufficient as we are."
Atamos BOT 25-02-2024 15:54
Hours pass as Atamos looses himself in the work before him. His thoughts drift from their current hunt, to the political changes in Vallaki and finally settling on Uyut. He missed the small dragon and his odd mushroom companion. If only Uyut was here to keep him company. The scimitar finally cools from its final coat of silver. Gleaming in the firelight Atamos gives the sword a few test swings. Not his preferred weapon but the priest was satisfied with the balance and edge. It will serve Georg well. He finds the hunter and offers him the now silvered blade, handle first. "All finished Georg. Give it a few swings and let me know what you think. I left the forge hot in case it needs any modifications."

Georg BOT 25-02-2024 18:44

Lila BOT 27-02-2024 03:15
Lila munches on some hardtack as they walk. "Take care not to overindludge, even in food. You would not want a heavy meal slowing you down when in pursuit of -- or fleeing from -- danger."
Stelinar BOT 27-02-2024 03:18

Stelinar BOT 28-02-2024 18:12
He sighs, starting to heat up the water with a bit of magic as they speak "I've told you in the past... I'm a neutral entity. Part of the Oath of the Dusk is embodying the concept of Truth. Truth does not discriminate, and it comes for all. Strahd Von Zarovich, no matter what my would be opinion of him would be were I not an adherent of Truth, is no exception. I'm not an honorable person, Lila, because it is not the duty of a Detective of the Dusk to be honorable. We are truthful, we are honest, and we embody our namesake concept. The Dusk encompasses the middle ground between light and dark, and we must stand firmly in the middle, so as not to muddy the grounds of Truth." He watches the water carefully to get it to the right temperature before beginning to mix the drink proper, the smell hitting the air mixed in with a hint of lavender "He requisitioned my services as a detective, and it would shatter my oath to say no. Many rely on deception and guile to protect themselves in the face of overwhelming odds... but Truth has proven just as an effective shield against this land." He finishes mixing the drink and slowly slides it over "I help you because we are friends, I help you because people will die if I do not. Regardless, it is to Von Zarovich's benefit not to bring this to him. He is currently at war with Soth, leader of the Death Knights. Other entities work against him from the shadows, such as the Arch Lich Vecna, whom I nearly fell victim to myself. We are currently in the middle of undead versus undead warfare, Lila. Plus... vampires hate rivals, even potential ones. It is why it is rare for a vampire to elevate their spawn to true vampiric status. They are very territorial in nature." He begins mixing his own brew, a cup of tea that Riannoc had taught him to make "Finally, the act of saving Rahadin fell within my morals, and my oath. In Darkon, we believe in fair trial. I cannot sit by and abide murder."

Georg BOT 05-03-2024 04:21

"Like we're brokers of peace or treaty makers or founders of a new nation." Georg imagines what it was like for each of the surviving nations to send a diplomat to sign a peace concord after the hundred-year's war, soon after the Mourning.
Stelinar BOT 05-03-2024 04:55
He raises an eyebrow as he writes his own name on the page, placing next to it "advisor." "That is... the role I think I'd fit best in, unless others might object. Bon Hwa... makes me nervous. I've done work for her in the past and..." He pinches the bridge of his nose "It got... complicated very quickly. That entire business led to an ally of mine... a valued one... to take her own life atop Mount Baratok." He says, a rare hint of remorse and grief entering his eyes "I've avoided that hut since... out of respect. I know among the Vistani are individuals that might hold the capabilities of a seer... my contact being one of them. A rogue among the Vistani, if you will. However she is... two days out, surrounded by trouble apparently. I was tempted to aid her but... it would deviate from our current task. She has more experience than I in this field of work." "Oh and um... Georg? Read this alone when you get a chance." He says with a slight smirk, passing over to him a sealed letter "Unrelated to the matters at hand, just something you might wish to read in private."
1
Lila BOT 05-03-2024 13:46
Lila eyes the sealed letter warily but promptly puts it out of her mind. "I do not think anyone comes away unscathed from dealing with Bon Hwa, but I will gladly pay the price if it gets us what we need to defeat this Vaewolf." She rises and says, "Now, is there any additional business before we depart for the hag's lair?"

DM [Esh] BOT 06-03-2024 02:43
With a destination and next course of action set, the heroes set off towards the revered and feared Dusk Shaman. Finishing up their breakfast at the detective agency, Stelinar tidies up and puts away anything still left out and locks the door behind him. As they do, Atamos, Lila and Stelinar mount up on their flying brooms and Georg climbs up on Argont, who does a final stretch and yawn before nuzzling his closest companion. Taking flight, they each head to the Berez Swamp, the location, unfortunately, known by each of them. High, high above the clouds, they fly above the little cities and even littler villages, the inhabitants so small from up so high. After some time the reach the swamp lands, and as the trees and foliage become more dense the group decides it may be time to touch down. Hitting the moist and loamy mud that squelches under foot, the group sets off deeper in Dusk Shaman's swamp. Some time, some troublesome terrain and several pesky mosquitoes later, Lila pushes away some of the brush to reveal a small dingy hut. Scattered around the hut Bon Hwa's servants, creations, soulbound... and what have you - each of different forms, each more monstrous and bizarre than the last - sit, lay, skulk or play, around. Each keep their eyes on you, as if synchronized, as you approach but none stop their actions, none hinder your path. Black smoke can be seen coming from its chimney stack and a strange melodic humming can be heard from within, beckoning...
1
Lila BOT 06-03-2024 02:54
Lila approaches the door and raises her fist to rap on the decaying wood, but first looks to her companions for confirmation that they are prepared for what comes next.
Stelinar BOT 06-03-2024 03:48
If he said he were prepared, he'd be lying. He merely had to bite the bullet for whatever came next and trust that the others can keep up with the shaman
Atamos BOT 06-03-2024 05:13
Atamos is wary, the hag has always given him the creeps. He reminds himself of why he is here. To stop the potential danger of the Vaewolf. To find its weakness. Perhaps the hag could see the benefit of stopping this beast. As they approach the hut, Atamos eyes the nearby creatures warily. They were not aggressive when last he was here, but there weren't so many either. He has to question what Bon-Hwa feeds these things.
Georg BOT 06-03-2024 22:45
As they soar through the moist air, Georg suddenly remembers that he has a sealed letter from Stelinar, and he pulls it out to read mid-travel since the drake is able to fly on auto-pilot... as slow of a reader as he is, he is determined to finish the letter before landing at the swamp...

Avrae BOT 07-03-2024 02:38
Esh[Kan¬π¬≥ | Thur‚Åπ | Dalyia¬≥ ]-5
Bon-Hwa
"Cooome innnnnn!" An odd sing-songy voice emanates from within the hut. On the third and final rap, the door opens, seemingly of its own volition. The group is welcomed to the interior of a dimly lit hut, strangely enough, you each notice despite your darkvision. Thick, eye-watering smoke claws at your senses as the sickly fumes and pleasant fragrances of various concoctions and ingredients fight for dominance. Yet each are neatly arranged in their places on the shelves and cupboards, surprisingly you notice her table, which almost always has some oddity on it is this time bare. "And just on time!!" On the other side of the room stands the old crone laughing, hunched and withered, draped in all manner of robes and cloaks, yet manages to still look regal and imposing. Various charms, baubles, masks and trinkets hang off her gnarled and crooked staff, off the tip of her head covering and even off of her. "It\'s oh so very excited!" An eerie but genuine smile spread on her lips, "Out of the others, I\'m the "seer" that you had decided to meet? I feel so honored, I\'m as giddy as young girl!" "Come! Come sit!" She calls out, spreading out her own gnarled and crooked fingers out to you, motioning for the companions to sit by the clean(-ish) table, (some of the stains just won\'t come out!). "Please, sit. I just put tea on for you. Be a dear and drink with this old crone." Bon Hwa procures five tea cups and saucers and places them in front of her then turns around and lifts the steaming kettle from behind her and pours the steaming liquid in each cup.
2
AM
Esh[Kan¬π¬≥ | Thur‚Åπ | Dalyia¬≥ ]-5
Bon-Hwa
Bon Hwa pauses for a second and snaps her fingers. One of the small monstrosities barges through holding a large ceramic bowl, placing it in front of the witch. "Can\'t forgot about dear Argont can we?" She says as she pours a large portion - more than what you\'d think the kettle can hold - into the bowl and snaps her fingers again. The little monster grabs the bowl, seemingly unaffected, or at least unaware of the boiling bowl and places it on the floor by the door. "But the dragon needs to stay outside, he can keep his head through the door but I can\'t have him bumping into any thing." With all the cups filled and at their places at the table, Bon Hwa claps her hands together, "What can I do for you fine folk on this lovely morning?"

Bon-Hwa

Bon Hwa takes a step to one of the shelves, lifting a vial with a dark liquid swirling within and crushes it in her bare hand. The thick liquid mixes with her blood in her palm, Bon Hwa clenches her fist, the twinned liquid dripping down her hand and wrist then thrusts her hand open, the concoction turns into a miasma that seeps into the pores of each of the guests, though only one in particular lets out an undulating scream. "The times with your father have been special have they not? You showed promise as a boy but failed to show anything for it and your father did what he could, whatever he could to do, anything he could subject you, any pain he would inflict on you, as long as it meant results. But unfortunately, Darkonite, you have failed then and you will fail now." As the miasma cloys to Stelinar\'s skin, invades his nostrils, his mouth, his eyes and ears he then erupts in a blue flame! Stelinar continues to scream, screams of torment, screams of pain and of suffering. A thousand lifetimes of agony unfold within his psyche, breaking him. Bringing him into madness. The chaotic wildness of the Weave bursts out of Stelinar launching him through the hut\'s shabby doors She concludes with a chuckle, "You may hate people like me, but Darkonite, but you misunderstand, I am no mere \'person\', I am an entity beyond even what your enlightened and brilliant mind can grasp. I am eternal, I am inevitable."

Lila BOT 12-03-2024 10:45
Lila cannot know what is happening inside of Stelinar. He is intimately familiar with pain, with being consumed by fire, she tells herself. This is just more of the same, is it not? He will persevere as he always has. Yes. That's how it will go. She has not just condemned to madness and unfathomable agony one of the very few that she - in her heart if not yet with her words - calls friend. It is a rare moment for Lila. A moment of painful introspection as she asks herself, is it worth it? Is any of it worth the pain, the effort? Why sacrifice to save Barovia from a monster. Barovia is a monster. And in that moment, had she the power she might very well have torn this demiplane asunder. For she is Lila Shxora, Huntress for the Raven Queen, and she slays monsters... But one does not serve the Queen without learning that, in the end, we are all monsters. She can let that knowledge destroy her, and others in the process, or she can push on. Stelinar has been a mentor of sorts to her these past few weeks, but he is by no means her moral compass. She turns her head and looks to Georg, the unfamiliar look in her eyes screaming "What do I do?"

Atamos BOT 12-03-2024 20:18
The but fades from Atamos's vision, replaced by a memory... `Atamos wipes the sweat from his eyes. The training room was his this morning. He was free to practice with sword, maul, morningstar, no others competing for time with the weapons. Straw litters the ground near the practice dummy he is targeting, each successive blow from the warhammer he currently wields adding to the pile The young acolyte jumps as the training room door opens behind him. In walks his father, missing his normal plate armor and instead dressed in a conservative tunic. One doesn't need armor for attending sermon. But it seems like Atamos is not the only one skipping the lectures today. Without word Atamos's father stands before him, armor less and weaponless. Atamos's own practice armor suddenly weighs him down, but it as much as the growing guilt in his gut. "What is our strongest shield Atamos?" His father asks, no hint of rebuke in his voice. "Faith." Atamos answers by rote. The question asked and answered dozens times. "Strike me." His father commands in a confident voice. Atamos doesn't move. A blow to his unarmored father could break bones. Could injure him. Sure, his father could heal any injury but there is always risk, always pain. The warhammer remains still at Atamos's side. "Strike me!" His father says again, his voice rising with the command. Lifting his hammer Atamos gives a half hearted swing. His father easily stepping aside as the hammer connects with the practice floor with a thump. "Do you have so little faith in your father that you must swing that hammer like a green novice. I said strike me boy. Now strike!" Again Atamos lifts his hammer, this time putting effort into the swing. The hammer comes down fast. Instead of dodging a small grin crosses his father's face. Atamos closes his eyes, not wanting to see the impact. BAAAM The hammer hits its target with a resounding thud. There is no cry of pain, no snap of broken bones. Atamos opens his eyes to s
2
Atamos BOT 12-03-2024 20:18
ee his father standing unharmed. Surrounding him is a glowing aura. A hardened field of force separating his head from the hammer still clutched in Atamos's hand. The young acolyte drops the hammer in astonishment, eyes widening. He heard his father was capable of working miracles, but this? This was amazing! The orb surrounding his father vanishes as the older man places a hand on his son's shoulders. "We don't just say these things to torture our acolytes Atamos. There is meaning behind our doctrine. Power. You can see the importance of training your body in the practice field. But it is the sermons that help us train our faith. Our faith is just as powerful a weapon against Tyr's enemies as that hammer of yours. One day you too will be able to wield your faith in Tyr as a weapon, but it takes training son." Atamos's shame deepens. The importance of the sermon he skipped had not crossed his mind. His father had obviously senses that shame as he gently pats his son's shoulder. "Go get cleaned up son. Perhaps it is time we start practicing sacred flame. A gift Tyr provides his faithful. We can do so after we catch the last half of the sermon your mother is giving." "Y-yes father." Atamos replies as he turns and rushes toward the shower room. ` The memory fades into the dark. Lost. Forgotten.
3
Georg BOT 12-03-2024 21:57
Several memories flash by in Georg's mind as he feels them extracted from him -- as if someone is pulling out his stomach through his esophagus and mouth --
First, a memory of their meeting. A delirious Georg, lying facedown in the mud of the forest a few miles from Sharn where he has spent every moment of the past week scouring for signs of Lyon. His body is covered in cold sweat and his sand-dry mouth tastes like bile. All around him, a dense fog as fallen -- so much moisture in the air that he tries to stick his tongue out and drink it, to no avail. He feels something wet and cold lapping at his forehead -- is this a wolf or another creature, here to put him out of his misery? He finally musters enough strength to open his eyes, his blurring vision focusing on an upside down image of a small silver-scaled drake, peeking at him curiously and licking him with its forsty, forked tongue. Georg sits up and returns the stare. He has never seen a drake or a dragon before... The drake hisses -- he is astonished that he finds himself understanding the series of strange metallic sounds. The drake asks, "what do you seek in your anguish, sad man? Are you searching for a lost love, the love of your life?"
As that memory is snatched from him, two hot streams pour down his cheeks from the corner of his eyes, and before he can feel the true pang of that loss, another memory makes its way out of his brain --
1
Georg BOT 12-03-2024 22:03
He is sitting by the Tser Pools, feet dipped in its cold waters, a fishing rod lazily held in his hand as he arcs his head upwards -- he is watching the silver drake fly around, just a day after he awoke and found that he has sprouted wings on his back. Argont is bad at turning, bad at maintaining elevation, bad at turning, bad at acceleration -- it's both adorable and funny to watch. Soaring next to Argont above the calm pools is a large dragon named Red. He has taken a strong liking to Argont and pretty much adopted him as a younger brother, teaching the drake how to flip and glide and even dip claws into the water to catch fish. Georg remembers smiling into the cloudy sky, feeling pride as the drake boy slowly masters the currents of the air. He remembers pulling up a big river bass, roasting and seasoning it over a crackling fire he has built, and handing it to the tired but grateful drake at the end of his flying lesson, patting Argont on the head and telling him what a good job he did.
Georg writhes as that spark of joy from that memory is torn out of him, and one last memory is extracted.
2
Georg BOT 12-03-2024 22:07
Mere minutes after coming to the cruel and bitter realization that after 12 months of searching, he has finally found out why both the Vistani seer and his enchanted paper bird brought him to the Abbey of St. Markovia -- because his husband's soul is now encaged within a failed, stitched-together flesh golem, Georg and his friends are surrounded by a maelstrom of spirits and risen dead on all sides. He watches as the golem that is now Lyon fends off several shadow spirit creatures with bare hands, to his right, trying to block them from reaching the ranger. To his left, Argont has unleashed a powerful torrent of flames from his mouth -- rivaling that of proud adult dragons, burning the shadow creatures who continue to multiply out of an amalgamation of vengeful spirits. His heart beats loudly as he worries for both of the loves of his life, as he and his friends manage to retreat and he fires arrow after arrow into the horde of risen dead. He feels their love and their protection so keenly, more so on the verge of death, and he knows what sacrifice looks like. He drags Lyon's new body out of the door before it slams shut, and he remembers the look in Argont's eyes as his body was covered in slashes and magical claw marks from the shadowspawns. It was a look of relief that he and Lyon made it out.
Georg would cry if he realizes and understands what he has lost at the end of the extraction, but he sits there numbly, unaware of what he has given up, for one cannot know what one has lost in these bargains with the dusk shaman.
2
Lila BOT 13-03-2024 02:42
Lila has never held particularly strongly to the memories of her past. Perhaps because Shadar-kai live countless lives, constantly being resurrected in the Shadowfell should they die out in the material plane (well, except those shadars that find themselves trapped within a Domain of Dread) and the weight of so many lives is too much for even an elven mind to contain. Or perhaps her memories are in fact property of the Raven Queen... Certainly after centuries of this cycle, no remnant remains of her early life, before the Queen's Fall, before her people were cursed...
"Shh!" the woman gently hisses as the girl following her steps into a crunchy pile of dried leaves. "What did I tell you, L-" she begins quietly, but the girl cuts her off, her voice barely managing to stay a whisper. "We must watch with our feet, not just our eyes," she recites proudly. The woman - tall and blond - gives the girl an affectionate ruffling of her auburn, pig-tailed hair. They are both dressed in forest green clothes, blending in to the trees and bushes around them. "And what else do your feet see?" she asks. The girl looks down and studies the ground carefully. "Deer. A family of them. They passed through here this morning." she answers without hesitation until she finishes and then suddenly looks at the woman, nervous that she's gotten something wrong. "Very good. Now, tell me how you deduced that." "Well," the girl begins...
but the memory -- that had lain dormant beneath Lila's conscious mind, a buried foundation for the edifice of her skill -- fades away to nothing. The pain that Lila feels is sharp and deep and so very unfamiliar. For the first few seconds it threatens to crush her -- imploded by the vacuum inside of her. But Shadar-kai are no strangers to pain. The Shadowfell elves have made pain their artform. And while Lila did not enjoy it like some of her kin do, she knows she can survive this. She knows she can keep going. She has to.
3

1
Stelinar BOT 13-03-2024 17:06
Meanwhile... A boy stood in front of a burning building, overlooking a small bay enshrouded by mists. The flames burn blue, with only the entrace to the building unharmed "What... could have caused this?" The boy says, before a small file lands at his feet. He reaches down, picking it up, looking it over
Bon-Hwa: Parasite, monster, witch, murderer
He looks from the file and up to the burning building. Anyone would be crazy to walk inside... but something within him beckoned. The very thing the witch had coveted from him. A burning desire to discover, to solve, to investigate. A desire that burned brighter than the very flames before him The boy walks inside, with nothing but a torn shirt and pants to his name. He looks around, noticing several desks with name labels upon them.
Gaspel Tingelight: Detective, Spy, partner
He picks the label up, staring at it for a time... as the holes in his shirt begin to knit themselves A hint of recognition enters the boy's eyes He makes his way from desk to desk, familiar names, smells. The smell of alcohol, strong on the nose. The smell of smoke... this one brought a pang of grief to his heart "Simon Torvul. The smoke got to his lungs." He says, surprised by this sudden leap in knowledge, like it was almost impulsive to list such facts Finally he comes upon one in particular
Godling Everson: Seeker of Truth, Head Detective, Mentor
The boy clutches his head for a moment, closing his eyes tightly as a pain wracks his mind. He realizes at this moment just how empty his head feels... He opens his eyes, looking in shock as the name label has transformed into a flintlock pistol in his palm. It was missing something however... He didn't know what... and he didn't have the stomach for this weapon, as he tosses it out the window in a hurry His breathing deepens, his form growing shakey (edited)
Stelinar BOT 13-03-2024 17:06
He looks around for a moment, noticing several files out in the open. Burnt... damaged... Savable He shakes his head at the thought. Preposterous. They were burnt, destroyed... And yet his eyes wander to a series of vials, bottles and equipment in the corner... Didn't matter, he didn't know how to use such th- How the hell did he know how to use such things? He finds himself already at work, trying to restore some semblance of the files...
Ebbasheyth (Warwick) BOT 13-03-2024 17:07
"I suggest you hurry... fool. Lest your companions toss your would-be corpse in the swamp. Not that this thought doesn't amuse me, but you have me strapped to said corpse." A voice echoes out, bouncing off of the walls around him as the boy looks about confused, his eyes widen. He thinks he has gone mad... and just returns to using his hands to ground himself...
Stelinar BOT 13-03-2024 17:07
On the outside however, The Detective lay broken, burned, laying against a tree on the outside of the hut... alone. Embers of draconic flame clung to him like a child and their blanket. His cap lay in his lap, no longer adding to the inquisitive aura he'd developed for himself over the last few years Against the tree lay but a boy way over his head... but he didn't care. He had to. The only way they would listen... was through example... He didn't know whether they were fearful of the witch, complicit, or just naive It didn't matter... he knew what a slippery slope dealing with this witch was. First it'd be their memories... then they would need something again. Then it'd be something more... One would say he'd hope this had sent the message... however... The Detective wasn't doing much hoping... or much of anything, as he lay there, dead to the world, the only sign of life being a high pitched short wheeze with each emitted breath. Burns etched into his skin, with only The Huntress knowing that the only one that could will them to heal... was The Detective himself. Not even The Adherent could help him... nor The Scaled Bravado bring him comfort His coat was gone... and his clothing had been replaced with some seemingly ordinary clothes of foreign origin, as if the glamoured armor he bore was still connected to him on a mental level. Only the perceptive would realize... that the holes in his shirt were slowly knitting themselves...
2
Argont [Georg's Drake companion] BOT 13-03-2024 22:17
*Argont, the silver drake, is now much smaller than he was before. He is standing between Stel, who's leaning against the tree, and a line of ugly little grubby minions that are hissing and making a ring around the detective, making strange little angry gestures. The drake snarls and growls, daring any one of those little flesh blobs to be the first to leap!* (edited)

1
DM [Esh] BOT 14-03-2024 02:52
Visions bombard the minds if Lila, Georg and Atamos. Sections of the swamp flow through their mind's eye; Your vision rushes you out of the witch's hut, quickly you scamper through the swamplands. Past the knotted tree, through the tangled vines, further and further you go. Abruptly you stop at a clearing. Murky depths of the swamplands pass by, the air hangs heavy with the scent of decay and a chorus of frogs and insects fills your ears. Moss-laden trees stand sentinel over the putrid waters, their gnarled branches reaching towards digging into the waters and reaching upwards, toward the gloomy sky. Amidst the tangled roots and twisting vines, a bubbling pool sits. Tepid and murkey the pool bubbles and gurgles. But you notice something, the sky doesn't seem as gloomy as the Barovia sky tends to be. Looking to the sky you don't see clouds, you don't see the Mists. No, you see the sun. You actually see the sun! You are in a time that predates the Mists, predates Strahd. But as you look at the glorious sun you see a twinkle. Something is coming. Coming right for you. It's getting bigger. And bigger. A flaming meteor streaks through the sky. The meteorite flies forward, racing towards you. Racing towards the swamp. The mass of metal hurdles towards you and you see it more closely. A comet of pure silver streaks forward and crashes in to the swampy waters sending a torrent spray of water and animals scampering. Crash landed, you finally get a good glance of the meteorite. A hunk of silver sits atop the murky pool, glowing in it's radiance like you've never seen on this plane. True Silver. Eventually the weight and the density gets the better of it and it slowly sinks down, like coveting hands the mud bubbles and squelches as it eventually envelopes the fallen comet, plunging the True Silver into its depths. The sky darkens, you realize the Mists and the gloom has returned. You now see the swamp in the present day. Untouched from those many aeons ago.

Stelinar BOT 16-03-2024 19:13
The boy wakes up at the desk he was working at before. He must have fallen asleep putting his nose to the grindstone. He shakes his head, attempting to wake himself up but failing to do so. A grogginess clung to him, ceasing to release his mind. He looks over and notices that some things were done- things that were incomplete when he had fallen asleep "... there is no one else here..." He mutters, before noticing a small note on top of one of the files
Did some work while you slept. - A
He shakes his head. Something about the handwriting stuck out to him, like something from a daydream but he couldn't quite connect the dots. He then notices his head had been lain on a small pillow, much to his confusion. He picks it up, going to place it off to the side when he notices yet another note underneath of it
You seemed tired, friend S-. - G & A
The name attributed to said friend was incomplete... and he had no idea who G or A was. Was this A the same as the one who had worked on his files? It was then he smelled something... something warm, soothing. "What the Hell- NO ONE ELSE IS HERE!" He shouts, rushing to the source as fast as he can, his shoes smacking against the wood floor with ferocity as he flings the door open, attempting to catch whoever had played to these prank- It was a cup of coffee... Just... a cup of coffee... With a note... a note used as a coaster... He cautiously walks over, picking the mug up and looking down
Wake up. - L-
Unlike the others this name was just simply blotched out with coffee. He sighs heavily, leaning over the table for a brief moment, taking in the warm smell of the brew as he thinks What was this place? Who were these people? From the files on Godling and Gaspel, this was a detective agency. He picks up the mug, still as warm as if it had just been made which should surely be impossible. However... what rules WAS he playing by in this place?
3
Stelinar BOT 16-03-2024 19:13
It was still on fire, blue flame crackling all around him. However, said flames felt as if they were an old friend, and a part of him knew they wouldn't do him harm. He even places a hand over one of them, feeling their warmth, but not the sting of their heat. Strange... even the wooden foundation seemed unaffected. He lifts the mug to his lips, taking a long drink, already feeling himself loosen up in response to the warm brew. He makes his way back to his... well, someone's, work space. Not like anyone else was using it. He begins looking at the files he and this mysterious A character had repaired. They knew what they were doing... if they were real and he hasn't simply gone mad.
Arcanus Sel-Borne: Sorcerer, Arch Magician, Grandfather
The name screams to him, as if the very blood in his veins boiled in response to it. It held weight, and despite having no context to it, it almost inspired him. The next however... did not
Armedus Sel-Borne: Serial Killer, Sorcerer, Father, deceased
This name filled him with dread, and as he looks down he once more sees the flintlock pistol in his hand, having replaced the mug of coffee. His eyes go wide with fear, once more hurling it out the nearby window, his breathing quickening in response He braces himself on the table. Something within him pressed him onward, no matter how much of himself wished to cease this endeavor. What was the point, all of this had nothing to do with him. He was nobody, had nobody. He was empty, blank. His eyes turn to the next, the most painful one yet
Celine Sel-Borne: Teacher, Druid, Mother, Murdered By Husband
The Boy breaks like a twig, his hands shaking, tears beginning to stream from his eyes. He didn't know why... but it hurt. Everything hurt. He wanted to die right now, he wanted to cease. But everyone knew... these dreaded domains wouldn't let anyone off that easily He finds his face buried into his arms, hunched over the table as he sobs

DM [Esh] BOT 17-03-2024 06:27
Traversing through the swamplands seemed like a difficult endeavor; the tangled roots and twisting vines, the buzzing and irritating insects flying and biting, the murky and mucky swamp waters caking your boots with thick mud. A trek that should have taken a few hours had taken only a fraction of that time as Bon Hwa's visions guide each step and each turn. Luckily, throughout the hike Stelinar's condition gradually improves; at first his mind and the words from his lips start to become more coherent and less of a ramble, and then his awareness of the world around him returns to his senses, until eventually though still groggy and dazed, he finally has the strength and the mental capabilities to dismount Argont and follow along with his companions. With the path seared into the minds of the others, the group makes quick work of the trail, avoiding any pitfalls, hazards or hindrances that usually are encountered in the Untamed Wilds. The shadows summoned by Lila aid as well, though several beasts and even monstrosities have been witnessed and reported the cover of nature itself shields them against any interruptions. Eventually, the reach the familiar pool where the meteorite had hit those many years ago.

Stelinar BOT 18-03-2024 21:33

The land of Darkon. The mists were there too... yet the Dusklight Detectives were born there. It was founded by mortal men. No magicks, no otherworldly aid. If such a group can come into being and make a difference in such a place... I daresay I like our odds." He keeps his eyes on the water. He hated water. Murky. Cloudy. Stung his eyes whenever he was in it. "Even if we fail, we have carved a path for others to follow. Have hope not in them, or us, but in the calling of such an endeavor. More exist that would feel drawn to such a conflict. Our efforts will not be in vain no matter the outcome."

DM [Esh] BOT 18-03-2024 23:37
With a last check, Lila and Georg make sure that the rigged ropes are properly secure, along with their breathing apparatuses. Everything checks out. The ranger pair jump in. The waters, murkier and cloudier than they even imagined make it difficult to navigate, only being able to see what's a few feet in front of them. It's slow going in the muddy waters, feeling through more than seeing but with the cognizant of the visions guiding the pair, they are able to deftly navigate through the tepid pool. Through the murky and obscuring waters a dim glow can be seen further ahead. Lila and Georg eye each other and swim to check it out. They see it! Half submerged in the thick sludge, a radiant chunk of Celestial Silver, glowing as bright as the day it landed!
Lila BOT 19-03-2024 00:42
Lila approaches cautiously, wary of some predator or guardian lurking nearby. She looks to Georg for confirmation, not quite trusting her own survival instincts.
Georg BOT 19-03-2024 01:14
Georg gestures to Lila, putting both arms in front of his face vertically, then peeking out from behind them, then points to Lila -- miming, you hide, and then he gestures to himself before pointing at the hunk of beautiful silver, meaning, I'll go check it out and be bait.
Stelinar BOT 19-03-2024 01:17
"I'm certain Lila is likely leading the charge as we speak, Atamos. They'll be back soon. Tea?" He says, already pulling out some kit as they wait
Lila BOT 19-03-2024 01:33

Georg BOT 19-03-2024 01:38
Georg shrugs and swims to the other side of the silver, expecting to need to help hoist from the other side to push it up out of the mud.
Atamos BOT 19-03-2024 05:37
"Yeah sure, tea is fine." The cleric continues to hold the rope while staring blankly into the water.
DM [Esh] BOT 19-03-2024 05:42
Georg swims closer to the Celestial Silver, swatting away loose debris, like driftwood, seaweeds and other floating vegetation away, trying to lift the chunk of metal but the thick mud holds on tight. After some time of tugging and pulling Georg is grateful for the air bubble around his face because playing around like this surely would have ran out his air supply. Taking a minute to locate her friend and companion, she notices the magic of the ring still active, causing the cloudy waters to be particularly thick near her friend, the weeds particularly clingy, hiding them both without them even putting in the effort themselves. Lila shrugs at the thought as she sees Georg still struggling in the murky waters and she swims over to him to see if there were to be any luck between the two of them but even with the little give they've gained the pair did not make much headway. Remembering the long rope tied to them, Lila motions to Georg to hold off on pulling the the meteorite and unties the long rope from her waist. The huntress then swims up to the meteorite and attempts to tie a harness to it. Seeing her struggle to lift it at all, Georg swims and assists her. Eventually they get it done, a harness secured around the big metal and remembering the signal Lila gives the rope three long tugs, indicating that they have found the silver.
1
DM [Esh] BOT 19-03-2024 05:42
Despite the conversations being held on the surface the detective and priest did not shirk off their own responsibilities grabbing the line the moment they saw the three tugs and started heaving. Seeing the exertion from the detective and priest Argont grabs the end of the rope with his mouth, adding his strength to the pull. With their combined strength, the trio manages to pull that rope, eventually seeing bubbles as the rangers shoot up from the depths, covered in muck and strands of seaweed as they're hanging on to the moss covered rope. Now on the water's surface all five hoist up the Celestial Silver, the internal glow no longer dimmed in the muddy waters.
DM [Esh] BOT 19-03-2024 05:42

DM [Esh] BOT 19-03-2024 16:33
SPLASH! The vine, thicker then Georg pulls Georg under the swamp water. Initially shocked at the turn of events everyone freezes but a fraction of a second but instinctively jumps in to action. Stelinar grabs another breathing cap, readying to jump in after the hunter, Lila nocks her bow, ready to do the same while Atamos readies a spell. But before they have a chance to jump to action, Georg gets thrusted back onto the swampy shore. Soaking wet, grimy and muddied Georg looks at his companions, gives a weak smiles and mouths "help!" The large vines around Georg slither and tighten again, constricting Georg even more. With Georg laying, all tangled up it's easier to notice. It's not vines Georg is entangled in, but you follow its form. It's a massive writhing snake!! Georg is entangled in the creature's tail. Following the rest of the serpentine body, your eyes trace it back in to the water but not too far away you can make out a serpentine neck of sorts, near invisible among the camouflaging foliage. Within the brush you see the neck going and going until it winds back towards you. A sleeping serpent head, as big as each you lay sleeping! It seems that it had caught the hunter unaware within its coils but is holding on tightly to its new cuddle buddy. Be careful. Even the slightest disturbance may awaken the massive creature.
Atamos BOT 19-03-2024 20:57

Stelinar BOT 19-03-2024 21:15
He simply watches whatever the hell it is he is watching, his eyes turning towards the silver as he tries to figure out how the hell they were going to get it away from this thing Oddly enough it was significantly harder to think the more and more Atamos got into this... He was sincerely starting to wonder if Atamos was more cracked then he was mere moments prior... and if he was cracked BEFORE the psychotic swamp witch got into his head Rock, noise, vibrations, broom, lack of feet to ground contact, think quick you bastard before Atamos stutters. Rock, noise, vibrations, they were able to lift it from the water, if they could get it in the air, they could simply fly it off. Problem: Broom had a weight capacity. He didn't know how much he weighed... nor how much the broom could take. No one was sitting around calculating the exact weight measurements a literal flying broom would take, people just jumped onto them and if it went slower clearly they were heavy. Maybe he could calculate this by using Fritz as a reference unit... how many Fritzes did this rock weigh... No he'd kill himself before he finished that train of thought. Different plan How many blood lyrics did this song have?! Rock, noise, vibrations. Silence? Perhaps, though his blood felt more unstable than usual, and he wasn't quite sure what that meant. Could mean he grew more tired, or it could mean he turned into a potted plant like Fritz apparently did on the regular Rock, noise, vibrations, distraction? Lure the creature away from the stone once Georg was liberated? What would be more enticing than 4 idiots in the middle of a swamp half addled out of their minds? Rock, noise, vibrations, distraction, WAIT HORN! The horn of silent alarm! Selective in nature! He could blare it as loud as he could away from the group and not a singular other creature in this hellhole would hear it except this bastard snake! Rock, noise, vibrations, distraction, escape

Lila BOT 22-03-2024 03:19
Realizing that it's not really that late and she doesn't feel particularly tired, Lila finishes the last ten arrows. Once that's done she settles herself on a spot on the floor and crosses her legs under her in a classic meditation position.
Stelinar BOT 22-03-2024 05:42
He stands there, genuinely wondering if she means to sleep in the forge And if it were part of his duties as a Detective to ask her to vacate No one had tried to slum it up in the forge before...
DM [Esh] BOT 22-03-2024 15:29
The heat of the forge rages despite the late evening as other laborers and even adventurers take on tasks and jobs of their own. "Excuse me!" A small but stout human woman brushes past you, "You using these?" She calls out pointing to some tongs on the wall besides where Atamos is working. "You better watch your friend over there," she points a dirty hand at the drooling Georg, "I've burned myself plenty while awake." Her eyes dart around, the burning forges, the loud banging of hammers on anvils, the flying debris of bits of metals and the filthy floor, "Though I gotta say, that's some talent." Taking the tongs and walking off. With your direct task and singular focus of crafting the arrows and other True Silver weapons near completion, the realization how busy the forges and workshops are. The yelling of communication between workers are heard, the grinding of a multitude of weapons at the station near you. Catching your eyes, the worker lifts his own in a silent greeting as he hurries to finish his work so he can get home in time for dinner.

Uyut of Frogrock BOT 25-03-2024 09:16
Uyut feels as though his soul is run through by Strahd with a rusted, serrated sword covered in barbed wire. The bastard stabs him suddenly, and then revels in his pain, every twisted barb and every sharp edge a memory he and Argont share, but Georg lacks now. However excruciating this is, though, he refuses to let it cloud his mind, for that is literally his sharpest and most versatile weapon. He thinks back to the very first time he's met Argont and Georg - it was a year or so ago, he reckons, Georg was selling cute, warm scarves at the market, with Argont small and hidden away in his nap basket beside the man. He remembers how Argont yelped a happy noise to get his attention, how they nuzzled each other's snouts, his sense of smell telling him that Argont is most definitely a dragon, how Argont tells him that he's in a nap basket because Georg brought him to a noisy market, how he tells Argont that his man partner is the most handsome man, and how Argont gleefuly replies that many man-shaped partners are more handsome than Georg, how Argont tells him that scarf-weaving reminds Georg of home in a tone that implies the most hidden of secrets, how Argont tells him to take a few scarves as a gift for their new friendship, how he helps him pick out an amber one for Atamos and a forest green for himself, and how Georg tried to sound angry but relented quite quickly with just how adorable Uyut looked in these scarves. He crystallises these memories in his mind, every one - a facet of a whole diamond of memories forming in the room that is his telepathic mind, the door connecting him with Georg opening under his command, the diamond floating into the man's mind. - I will make you remember, Georg, piece by piece if I have to. (edited)

Uyut of Frogrock BOT 02-04-2024 00:18
The small dragon's tail wiggles happily at the words that evoke in him so many memories of nights spent together, and he cannot help but attest: - "Do not let his polite, likeable, handsome exterior fool you, for inside him dwells a beast that knows no mercy. Mmhh~" - Uyut's long since stopped counting the many, many, many times he's felt lucky to meet his beloved, and another one just now makes trying to recount every single one even more impossible.

DM [Esh] BOT 03-04-2024 19:51
Completely off balanced and caught unaware Uyut's psionic dagger pierces the lead assassin's heart, the impact blasting her back against the wall. Though the psychic blade had left no mark, the wounds and its after effects are clearly visible. Blood gushes out of her mouth, nose, eyes and ears. The assassin feels her body convuling from the psychic trauma. "No!" She barely let's out above a whisper. "NO!" She yells out, straining her words, "YOU WILL DIE, IF NOT BY MY HAND THEN BY ANOTHER OF US! BY HIM " Putting all of her effort, she takes a deep breath and let's out a shrill whistle. The whistle reverberates through the alleyways and streets. Another signal call. It takes but a moment but the call is answered. From the edge of town you can see shadows emerging, more vampire assassins climb down the building walls, more werewolf brutes prowl the streets. They are coming for you.

DM [Esh] BOT 04-04-2024 14:43
The heroes are preparing to retreat realizing that they are outnumbered. The mysterious figure strides ever closer almost making it to the center but the nearby vampire, unfamiliar with the figure it charges at them, but with no effort the cloak evades the strikes. In retaliation, a hand crossbow whips out from underneath the cloak, glowing bolt shoots out point blank into the vampire's head, causing a miniature explosion, disintegrating the vampire where it stood. The shot had caused the figure's hood to shift off their face, revealing a olive skinned woman with fierce eyes and a wicked grin. Her eyes dart left and right scanning the surrounding area the flicks her cloak around her causing her to vanish into shadows. She reappears! On the rooftop! Seeing the snipers and assassins she looses a volley of radiant-tipped bolts, each hitting their mark. Each causing a miniature nova as the hit vampire crumbles to radiant dust. But she sees the ever encroaching reinforcements and this had only brought a genuine smile to her lips. The woman flicks her cloak once more vanishing into shadows again and reappearing above an oncoming swarm. She reaches into her cloak and pulls out a yellow orb. The woman clicks a button on the orb causing it to give a radiant glow and throws it at the horde. One. Two.. Three... boom A small explosion can be heard but the miniature sunrise is what catches your attention- if her previous actions didn't already. The oncoming horde now nothing but glowing dust.

DM [Esh] BOT 10-04-2024 04:32
Getting what they need, the group quickly packs their things and prepares for the next step of their mission. With each of them, broom in hand - except Uyut and Argont take to the sky. Though this time Lila advises they they stay lower, away from the cover of the clouds. This will allow them a better view of the ground below, to better see tracks, to better see any activity. But it does not come without any risks. Being closer to the ground and not under the cover of Barovia's thick clouds makes it easier to be seen, just experiencing that your actions have been noted and your movements have been followed. Nonethless Lila deems it worth the risk and after flying for a couple of hours, her persistence pays off. Despite the shaman's curse still active, Lila pushes through and sees the signs of trouble. Blood. Bodies. Destruction. Following the newly found "trail" leads to a small clearing.
1
Lila BOT 10-04-2024 12:57
I wish I could say I am surprised...
Atamos BOT 10-04-2024 17:32
By Tyr's eye, it's a bloody massacre.
Lila BOT 10-04-2024 19:48
Lila hovers on her broom just a few feet from the ground -- close enough to inspect without leaving tracks. She examines the bodies for information on how they died and when.
Atamos BOT 10-04-2024 19:57
Atamos follows Lila down, saying a silent prayer for those that fell here. He looks for any that are holding weapons or looks well armored. I have a scroll of speak with dead, we can ask one of them what has happened here. Assuming this is related to our quarry, we could ask about numbers, the direction of the attack and so forth.
Georg BOT 10-04-2024 19:59
But does knowing how many there are within the cave actually help us change our plans? Will we choose not to attack or give up altogether if the threat seems too big? Who else in this valley can assist us, as we're the only people who have this special silver? Even if the countess sent her own forces now, they wouldn't be much use against them, right?
Lila BOT 10-04-2024 20:02

Georg BOT 10-04-2024 20:03
Fair. I guess it would be fun to watch Atamos talk to a dead person.
Atamos BOT 10-04-2024 20:08
It may change our tactics, but not our overall strategy. Do we kite enemies or charge them. Do we draw them to us or seek out their lair. Do we need to hunt down several smaller groups or one larger group. As Lila said, knowledge is power.
DM [Esh] BOT 12-04-2024 02:48
Surveying the scene you can see bodies every where. Mangled, lacerated, devoured and everything in between. What sticks out the most is the horrid stench of gore and decay, gauging that the attack is semi fresh, happening maybe within the day. No later than the next. Originally, a small traveling group, you can see small tents set up for the evening and some wagons ladened with goods. Other than the ones knocked over or destroyed during the massacre, the goods all untouched. At the center of the camp there is a campfire, though on the verge of dying, the flames still flickering and clinging to life. In between the campfire and your location there are some bodies but also large amounts of blood staining the ground underneath though you can make out several prints within the blood. Some belonging to a large, clawed entity but several others - people scampering and fleeing and even some horse tracks running past you. Before the tracks and in between you and the pooled blood is a dead body, cut down and face down, near him on the ground is some shredded pieces of armor - must have been so thoroughly cut down that it had shredded through armor and uniform. Further into the camp, you can see a robed body slumped up against the side of one of the tents. Or you think it's a body, all you can see is a heavily brutalized mound of flesh. Further in, you see more bodies. From their (idenfiable) clothing you see some look like they were armored while others look to be simple merchants or travelers butchered where they stood.
1
1
Atamos BOT 12-04-2024 05:01
Atamos approaches the nearest body, trying to gather what information he can about the bodies and what killed them. Lacerations, and poison in the blood. Trauma to the head or vital regions. How deep are the lacerations, what area does the trauma cover. From this he wishes to extrapolate what caused the damage, how big the claws that cut, or the weapon that bludgeoned,
Georg BOT 12-04-2024 05:32
Georg hates scenes of massacre. This is triggering his memories of the most despicable parts of the 100 year's war in Khorvaire that he served in. Arriving at villages that have been razed by enemy nations, sometimes finding mass graves where all the dead body are already cremated by the cannon fire of artifice. "I'm ... I'm going to scout around and look out for danger. Call me if you need help with any forensic stuff." He says, green to his face around the scenes of gore. [Draconic] "Come on, new friend... or possibly old friend, if the visions that cutie Uyut showed me are true." Georg says warmly to the silver drake. "Help me with keeping a lookout?" Without waiting for an answer, Georg races to the nearest trees and begins climbing with incredible speed until he's pretty much hanging at the top, squinting his eyes to look all around for possible signs of danger that might approach them.
Argont [Georg's Drake companion] BOT 12-04-2024 05:33
The drake happily takes to the air and scouts by circling around upon his wings.
Lila BOT 12-04-2024 06:36
Lila takes a look at the next closest body, searching for similar clues as Atamos. [Investigation 24]
DM [Esh] BOT 14-04-2024 01:29
Lila and Atamos make for the first body they can reach and it is bad. It appears to be a mercenary or perhaps a hunter of some kind, maimed and face down it is hard to really identify the individual but as a healer Atamos has had experience with his share of wounds and so puts his experience to work. Kneeling down to the body Atamos can see that the man killed was a tough and weathered man so the blows that killed him were powerful, two deep slashes and a bite. The man had no chance. Taking a step back, Lila examines the scene instead of the singular victim. Next to which, the lays scrapped remnants of some armor, leather and scale, by the slashed up scraps, not too different than Lila's own. Definitely hunters. Inspecting the armor pieces she finds a ripped out crest. Easy enough to identify, she's seen the crest before, the hunter had belonged to the Dead Poacher's Society, a lodge of hunters of all kinds. Comparing the clothing and armor to Atamos's victim Lila determines they are the same and goes to look the victim over. The shredded armor scraps do not belong to this one. There were two hunters here, but now there is only one. Tracks. Human prints, monstrosity prints and... horse prints. Running southward - where the companions had arrived from. Lila follows the prints passed Atamos to the bloodstains. A lot of blood. With all the information Lila had picked up so far she tries to recreate the scene in her mind's eye; The monster attacks this Dead Poacher, and badly, footsteps and blood splatterings indicate it was a bad wound. The Poacher mounts on his horse, barely any lifeblood left, his only option is to retreat or die. The companion, the now dead companion and been trying to simultaneously fend off the monster and mount the horse as well but was not successful as he now lays face down in the snow.
1
DM [Esh] BOT 14-04-2024 01:29
The mounted and wounded victim gets attacked once more as parts of its armor - the Dead Poacher's Society crest among them gets slashed off - but that's it as it had been successful in retreating. If the victim did not die from its wounds on its way there, the two investigators can properly deduce where that victim had ran to.
Lila BOT 14-04-2024 02:34
There was at least one survivor of this attack. she tells the others. We should try to find him before it is too late. Lest one get the wrong idea and think Lila has grown an ounce of compassion, she explains. An eyewitness to what happened here will give us information we could never glean from merely studying the scene.
Atamos BOT 14-04-2024 04:49
Then we must hurry. I still may be able to heal them and... we may be able to tell what curses or diseases the monster holds by studying him. Atamos's telepathic tone is one of guilt, as if Atamos is ashamed to think of maters with such practicality. But one does what one needs to in Barovia.
Georg BOT 14-04-2024 09:20
I also have some magical reserves and potions for healing, if they can come in handy. You should save your mental energy, Atamos -- you are quite the bastion of power in battle, and we may need your full strength for what's ahead!
Lila BOT 14-04-2024 10:14
`Lila doesn't waste another moment and immediately sets off to follow the tracks.*
DM [Esh] BOT 14-04-2024 15:04
Argont, Georg and Uyut search beyond the camp in case the attackers decide to go for a second round. Thankfully the area is clear of any attackers. The sentries see the blood trail from the wounded survivor too but it gets lost in the woods. At least they made it that far.
Lila BOT 14-04-2024 16:10
Lila stops at the edge of the woods. The trail will be significantly more difficult to follow through there. she states with uncharacteristic disheartenment. Perhaps we should examine the rest of this massacre first. she suggests.
Georg BOT 14-04-2024 20:35
It's possible that something else entirely picked off the survivor -- catching bloody scent on the wind, predators having nothing to do with the big bad wolf, possibly. I can send out our drake friend here to search around by air as we continue forensics here, if you want to try to cover both?
Atamos BOT 15-04-2024 03:43

Georg BOT 15-04-2024 10:38

Uyut of Frogrock BOT 15-04-2024 19:37

Argont [Georg's Drake companion] BOT 15-04-2024 20:43
Argont is extremely happy to be Uyut's flying companion and follows the small dragon with his wings stretched.
Lila BOT 15-04-2024 20:48
Lila grunts her agreement with this plan, giving no sign of relief at not needing to enter the woods yet. She returns to her investigation, moving next to the heavily brutalized body...
DM [Esh] BOT 16-04-2024 02:55
Uyut and Argont fly in tandem across the Svalich woods past the clearing and towards the direction of the bloody trail left by the survivor. The horses trail has left deep hoof prints in the path indicating a fast and heavy pace. They rode like hell to get out of there. Following the path the two dragons fly closer to the ground to get a closer look where they see the trail continue going hard. Fortunately, they also notice that the blood spatter seems to diminish despite the horse's continued prints. It's safe to say that the rider didn't bleed out during the ride.
DM [Esh] BOT 16-04-2024 06:50
Lila goes to the next body. Careful to avoid disturbing any more bodies- or ruining her boots. The blood makes it too sticky to prowl properly. Coming up to the body and she immediately sees that this body had been attacked more severely than the others. While the entire area had been annihilated, this figure was brutalized as if the vaewolf had focused on the now flesh mound. Like special attention was given, the body is mangled and mauled like no other making it extremely difficult to identify anything about who the body was. Continuing her examination, Lila can determine that although shredded, the figure had been wearing vestments, religious ones of some kind, but it's difficult to identify more than that on the individual.
Lila BOT 16-04-2024 07:57
Lila searches the area around the body for any items that might have belonged to the victim -- a prayer book, a religious icon, or some other sacrament -- that might help identify the man's faith or offer some clue as to why he warranted such special attention from these creatures.
Lila BOT 16-04-2024 15:09
Atamos, this victim was a man of faith. Perhaps that is why he was targeted so. Can you aid me in searching for any clues to his identity or his faith?
Atamos BOT 16-04-2024 15:20
Of course Atamos kneels, looking for signs of the various regions he knows. Holy symbols are the easy tell, but other factors can provide clues. Tattoos representing life time devotion, scars from self flagellation a practice he is glad Tyr's devotees abhor, piercings in certain locations, brands from the religions following more possessive gods.
1
DM [Esh] BOT 17-04-2024 07:19
As a fellow man of the cloth Atamos sifts through the mutilated corpse. Though it's attacker did a thorough job; any large symbols or religious items have been utterly destroyed as they're shredded or physically broken but Atamos's familiarity has been able to determine based on the shredded cloths colors and bits and pieces of any holy symbols that this person had been a follower of the Morning Lord and an attendee of Father Lucian's Petrovich's church of St. Andral.
Atamos BOT 17-04-2024 13:52

Lila BOT 17-04-2024 23:07

DM [Esh] BOT 17-04-2024 23:44
Over here Atamos sees three bodies. One Dead Poacher's mercenary and two civilians; one dressed like a merchant and the other a simple traveler. The civilians have different wounds than the others. Small slashes line their body as well as deep punctures. It looks like they had died from sword wounds, with the mercenary still holding the weapon before being cut down by the Vaewolf himself.
Atamos BOT 17-04-2024 23:46
Over here, these wounds seem to have come from weapons. I suppose the Vaewolf travels with minions bearing weapons.
1
Georg BOT 18-04-2024 00:02
So... this is a creature that's definitely intelligent enough to want something, and charismatic enough to command minions that carry weapons... what could it possibly want?
Lila BOT 18-04-2024 00:03
Perhaps. With such powers as they possess in their own flesh I am loathe to find out how much deadlier they are with suitable weaponry. Lila stares at the cut up bodies a little longer. The slashes are small, which she has a hard time imagining such savage brutes inflicting these wounds...
DM [Esh] BOT 18-04-2024 04:18
Something does not sit right with the huntress, and even with her skills with the hunt diminished from the Witch's curse there are just some intuition so ingrained there is no separation. Lila joins Atamos at the new bodies seeing the mercenary cut down the two civilians. While Lila may not have had any firsthand experience with the poachers she knows wonton slaughter of people are not their play. She goes over the bodies again. She goes over the wounds on the civilians again. She identifies each of the cuts and slashes, how they were made, the movements of the attacker and the damages inflicted. She looks over the attacker, the Dead Poacher hunter. His weapon. Something just does not add up. Even if you were to consider the poachers had attacked this camp prior to the Vaewolf attack... this is the only attack. The previous bodies strictly shows Vaewolf marks. She briefly glances at the other bodies, the rest of the damages done to the camp itself - not one single sign of human-inflicted damage. Not to the dead, not to the camp, nothing. She scans the bodies again, and that's when she sees it. The mercenary's face. Even in death it is plain as day, how could she not have noticed sooner? She bends down, rolls up an eye lid. Noticeably dilated, the face's expression - stone cold and rigid. The mercenary had been enthralled to kill his own allies. Another power of the Vaewolf identified; it isn't just a pure brutalizing savage gained from its Lycan genes, it has the vampiric ability to charm and enthrall too, something to take precaution against during the fight against it. Another strength they may be able to fortify against now with the knowledge of what they are up against. Another chance to succeed in this fight for the lives of the entire realm.
2
Lila BOT 18-04-2024 09:22
Lila relays these findings to the others. This is truly worrisome, for Georg and I have been forced to fight off ensorcelled villagers before. She doesn't mention how many of them she killed; she isn't really sure. She just remembers what a horrible waste of arrows it was. Though this does lead me to wonder how many of the Vaewolf's lycan and undead followers are similarly enthralled. Further speculation will have to wait as Lila goes to investigate the next body.

Georg BOT 18-04-2024 10:20
Having been under similar effects before that clouded my brain and made me turn on my companions, I have fashioned a brooch out of some of dragon scales -- oh... Does the Vaewolf have the means to reach any victim no matter the distance or does this better indicate how brutally quick and efficient this monster is.
DM [Esh] BOT 19-04-2024 18:59

Atamos BOT 19-04-2024 22:56
It seems they are learning more and more about this creature. Atamos is still curious as to why the priest of the Morning Lord was targeted. It settles in his mind which spirit he should ask for guidance. The cleric approaches the fallen priest, removing a scroll from its case and reciting the divine prayer. "Spirt of the fallen, I seek what knowledge you hold and in bargain I provide the promise your death will not go without purpose. I will use what knowledge you provide to slay the evil beast that attacked you, and in doing so, prevent any future harm it may bring. My first question is this." Atamos clears his throat. "What can you tell us of the creature that attacked you?"
2
DM [Esh] BOT 21-04-2024 02:47
The necromantic magic of the priest of Tyr imbues the dead corpse. The dark energies that surround the mutilated man are visible, as is the sudden jerk as the body animates but it is obvious that the figure before you is something... different. Nonetheless the brutality that the body had endured in the last moments of its life is proving to be everlasting. The corpse's jaw hangs limp and it let's out a blood curdling scream! It writhes and lashes out, arms flailing as they try to make sense of the tumultuous shift. "Morning Lord! Morning Lord!? There is only darkness!! Why is there only DARKNESS?!" An empty, hollow eye stares at Atamos - the other eye socket, only a widened gash. It takes a moment to register the question but it hears. Before it can answer, another scream of pain escapes it's remnants of lips but it stutters in terror, "The creature! Terrifying! Standing ten feet tall and it moved with incredible speed! It was there then it was there before your eyes can follow! It moved like it was in two places at once. It wiped out our camp like we were ants! Nothing survived! Nothing could survive! It was a monster! But it was more! The ferocity of beast but its eyes! It had the cunning and intelligence that matched the Lord of these lands" The corpse was heaving as if it was trying to cry, but no tears would be produced from its destroyed body. It then froze, with the question answered, the magic suspended it's animation, awaiting its next question or the spell to expire.
1
Atamos BOT 21-04-2024 03:13

DM [Esh] BOT 21-04-2024 03:43
The corpse reanimates again upon hearing the second question, it croaks as if unable to form the words with a torn throat but it manages to eek out a terrified recollection, "I do not know! As I had witnessed the destruction around me I held on to my amulet of the Morning Lord and prayed for salvation. As I uttered the words of my prayer, the creature stopped dead in its tracks as if the words had frozen it. I hadn't realized that this is particular was what had caught its attention and I continued my plea. It's ears piqued at my words and it's eyes twisted into the cruelest of slits. It had then rushed at me with the most hateful rage. It's eyes bloodred filled with rancor and venom, it's attacks against me focused with pure enmity." The body flails, trying to fend off the phantom force of pure hate rending the last of its life before slumping over again as the question had been answered.

Atamos BOT 21-04-2024 18:12

Atamos BOT 21-04-2024 18:16

Atamos BOT 26-04-2024 21:22
