DM [Esh] BOT 28-04-2024 21:35
Situated within the dense thicket adjacent to Lake Baratok, the Dead Poacher's Society is a gathering hub and community for those who dare challenge the dangers of Barovia and its perilous creatures. Though never having been there before, the lodge's location is common enough knowledge for the rangers and so hopping on to their flying brooms (or wings), the companions set off on a direct course. Through the gloomy skies and heavy clouds, they fly high above the the darkened lands, above all the troubled souls and landborne dangers. They arrive at the lodge, a heavily fortified compound of ash-scorched trees from the Svalich Woods. A rigid defense against the dangers outside trying to get in but also a stark reminder to those within of what lies beyond. The heroes finally touch down after an achey flight and approach the heavy wooden door, rap the greeting code against it's frame and the doors swing open for them. The companions are greeted with heavy glares from a rough crowd. Scowls and growls from hard and hardy men and women, many geared to the nines and itching for a fight, many more sporting various kinds of scars and other vicious wounds gifted to them by the things that they hunt and also hunt them. Hanging from the ceiling, a long chalkboard hangs, covered with scrawls of various adventurers' names, their titles, deeds, or, more somberly, their deaths. A long bar runs down one length of the hall, a grizzled old man offering a variety of drinks and spirits to its patrons looks at your entry and curtly asks "What you want?"
Lila BOT 28-04-2024 21:47
"Drinks," Lila says, laying out a handful of coins on the bar. "And information." Her dark eyes scan the room for signs of someone recently injured.
DM [Esh] BOT 28-04-2024 22:33
The bar keep pours a glass of what he still had his hand then slides the glass to Lila. "Information?" He growls "I prefer my whiskey over ice. Oh? You seeking different information?" The barkeep feigns surprise, "Have I seen you around here before?" Ignoring the bar keep's comments, Lila scans the entire room, ignoring the ones staring back. As if there was a magical glowing sign pointing the way, streaks of blood paint a path way on the floor leading to the back of the lodge.
Atamos BOT 29-04-2024 17:03
Atamos feels out of place in the lodge. He has never been one to find pleasure in hunting vicious beasts, and his heavy armor is a visible sign to all he is out of his element.
Lila BOT 01-05-2024 02:00
"You have seen me here before, yes," Lila replies, barely glancing back at the barkeep. "But only because I wished to be seen." A trail of blood leads to the back. she relays to the others. "On second thought, we will take those drinks later," she says and sets off to follow the trail of blood.
Georg BOT 01-05-2024 02:39
Georg follows close behind Lila, silently falling into the comfort of being her second pair of eyes and ears, keeping his awareness tuned on the other 180¬∞ that she is less focused on at any moment.
DM [Esh] BOT 01-05-2024 03:01
The huntress heads to the back but almost bumps into a brick wall of a man as Georg slows her down with a soft touch on her shoulder. "Where you headin'?" A gruff man, as tall as a Goliath, though true lineage is indeterminate huffs again and places burly arms as thick as Lila's leg across his chest blocking the path of the two rangers.
Lila BOT 01-05-2024 03:10
"Someone arrived here not long ago. Injured badly. We are here to help." Does anyone else want to deal with this son-of-an-ogre? I fear my patience is wearing thin.
DM [Esh] BOT 01-05-2024 03:40
The son-of-an-ogre holds his ground- and his grimace. He runs his eyes up and down each of you, noticing the weariness and grime of travel sticking to your clothing. "You don't look like the 'helping' sort... Can't say I've seen anyone like that lately."
Atamos BOT 01-05-2024 03:49
I'll see what help I can offer. Atamos says to Lila as he approaches the burly man. "Surely a war priest seems like the 'helping sort', especially for someone with a battle wound as severe as to leave a trail of blood. Come now the patient's wounds aren't going to close themselves are they?"
DM [Esh] BOT 01-05-2024 04:13
The mountain of a man points his sausage of a finger out across the room, "We got guys coming in all the time with nicks an' scrapes. Ya think these guys don't know what they're doing? Ya think we ain't got it covered? B'sides, ain't no one like that here today." He repeats again, puffing up his chest daring you to challenge him on that.
Atamos BOT 01-05-2024 05:39
"Listen, I appreciate the tough guy act, but both you and I can see the trail of blood here." Atamos points. "We're all here for the hunt right? I want what did this." Atamos thumbs his finger at Lila. "She wants what did this. I'm here to help, not to harm." Atamos pulls a stack of platinum coins from his pocket. "Help me help you."
DM [Esh] BOT 01-05-2024 13:09
Refusing to even acknowledge the blood staining the floor and simultaneously plucking the platinum from the rotund priest's fingers. "Ain't no blood here.." But before the brute can pocket the coin a swift and wily figure whips to the front, grabs the coin right out of the brute's hand and deftly turns back to Atamos. "You heard the man." Although thin, a wiry woman packed with lean muscles and very loose attire glares at the war priest but tosses the platinum coin back to Atamos, "Your coins no good here." Several scars can be seen across the lady's face and body, some inflicted from the dangerous beasts roaming Barovia but many more, a testament to rigorous training and trials. The hand and forearm holding the coin is wrapped with bracers, embedded with nasty rivets and hardened leather, as well as her other fist and forearm, both elbows, knees and boots. There is no mistake that the wiry muscles and the swift, deft movement belongs to a very capable individual, the loose clothing allowing for quick and easy movements. "We appreciate your offer," she remarks sarcastically "but your help isn't needed - or wanted." The hulk repositions his arms over his chest and readjusts his stance, expecting conflict.
DM [Esh] BOT 02-05-2024 05:03
Lila and Atamos continue the direct method while Georg, who originally accompanied Lila put on a show of boredom and indifference, walked off and using his natural abilities of his mastering his surroundings had been able to sneak past the brute and the martialist practically invisible. Accompanying his companion, the psychic dragon Uyut, used his mental abilities to break the veil of the minds around him, perceiving himself to be unnoticeable, though knowing it only goes so far, he too treaded quietly past the two guardians. The pair make it to the back room where they see a Mummy of a man, fully enshrouded in bandages tinged with red as the wounds continue to bleed. Bloodied bowls of water show that the person's dressings have been changed recently. Rough and uneven snoring indicate that he's resting and recovering but by the way he is breathing he had most likely taken damage there too. Georg and Uyut approach closer, giving a better view of the wounds recieved. Even through the thick bandages you can see the deep lacerations that tore through his body and the amount of blood that was lost. Surprisingly, he survived at all. A sure tell of how hardy this man is.

Georg BOT 03-05-2024 21:44

DM [Esh] BOT 03-05-2024 22:21

The man shrugged, the Dead Poacher's Society has weirder individuals. Instantly the man's wounds start to stitch up and vigor fills his complexion. Georg hears the draw of a bow from behind him. Standing behind Georg coming in as silently as the night that even Uyut did not notice stands a 7 foot hulking half-orc with a sneering face, eyes drawn as far as his bow, nocked arrow aimed at the back of Georg's head. Lila BOT 06-05-2024 02:08

DM [Esh] BOT 06-05-2024 03:31

Physically it looked more werewolf-like I suppose, but larger than even any werebears that I've seen. It was massive! It's face.. wasn't fully a beast though, it had a vampire's fangs and a wicked, cruel smile filled with teeth and eyes that just seem to bore into your soul." Alden shudders as the thoughts flow through him.

Towards Vallaki, as the crow, or in this thw raven flies, they make it to the church before it gets too late. Landing on to the grounds, they see a a slouching, centuries-old stone church, a worn structure from its former glory. Walking forth they come to the decrepit wooden walls lined with cracked stained-glass windows depicting pious saints. A fence of wrought iron encloses a garden of gravestones to the side of the church. A thin mist creeps among the graves. The group arrive at the still heavy and sturdy doors.

Lila BOT 10-05-2024 04:23

DM [Esh] BOT 10-05-2024 04:27

Atamos BOT 10-05-2024 05:26
Atamos dismounts his broom and steps towards the church. Thoughts of despair and helplessness going through his mind. The fallen priest, the words of failure the spoken by a dead man. Words Atamos now must deliver. Atamos's can't help but feel a failure himself. Never before had he felt so distant from Tyr, and yet he cannot question why. He had been in this land for years now. Never once hearing the voice of his God. Not feeling his presence. It was as if the lands between the fog were empty, forsaken. What did that mean for Atamos. Would he one day end up like the priest. In pieces scattered in a forest, life blood staining the ground. Or worse, drained by the count or one of his spawn, turned into one of the very creatures he has fought against. He was not ready when the priest answered the door. Leaving an uncomfortable moment of silence Atamos finally speaks. "Father Petrovich I presume? We have yet to meet. My name is Atamos, cleric of Tyr. Unfortunately I bear from tidings. May we come in?"

DM [Esh] BOT 10-05-2024 17:34
At first the Father is taken back. Two little dragons accompany another man of the cloth - well, cloth and heavy armor as well as two rough and tumble 'adventurers'. After the initial shock of the dragons Father Petrovich sees the others and shrugs Not the strangest group that have come to these doors. One moment." More jangling and fumbling as the Father steps back to open the grand doors. "Come in. Rest your weary bones," the weary Father offers, "My apologies on our accommodations. "Here, you can take off your equipment and sit down here. Rest." Father Lucian opens a nearby door and goes into the room, a small kitchen of some sort. Georg BOT 13-05-2024 05:07

DM [Esh] BOT 13-05-2024 05:21
A genuine smile reaches Father Lucian's face. To help people is his mission and is what fills him with joy. Being able to do that tonight nourishes his soul. "You can sleep in the quarters of some of the brothers. They will not be back in quite some time. A good place to stay warm and to tend to your things. Please do not hesitate to come to me if there is anything else. Restful sleep for all of you." With that he bows and smiles before heading off. In a few rooms over you can hear the steady cadence of voiced enchantments as he reinforces the wards as promised.
Uyut of Frogrock BOT 13-05-2024 08:20
"Well, with our daily obligations out of the way, Atamos and Georg have a nightly obligation as well. Me and Argont are both undercuddled, and you two need to fix that."
2
Georg BOT 13-05-2024 09:00
"That's a good suggestion -- if the visions you've shown me about my past with Argont are indeed true, perhaps cuddles will help bring those memories back!"
Lila BOT 13-05-2024 10:41
Lila makes sure to get her own room, far from the threat of cuddling. She sits herself cross-legged on the stone floor and attempts to meditate. She expects to meet with difficulty - so many things have been difficult lately - but instead finds herself easily slipping into the trance state, connecting with the unconscious parts of herself that holds so many forgotten fragments of her past. She emerges hours later feeling more whole than she has in a long time, since well before the visit to Bon Hwa...
3
Atamos BOT 13-05-2024 15:27
Perhaps it was the night resting in a chapel, or simply having Uyut back at his side, but Atamos felt refreshed in body and in spirit. He could recall the feeling of doubt and loneliness that plagued him the day before, but could fathom where the feelings came from. He was ready to continue his work as one of Tyr's chosen and wipe out injustice and evil in this land. His stomach gives a loud rumble. But first... "Good morning Uyut, man am I ever hungry."
Uyut of Frogrock BOT 13-05-2024 15:37
Sleeping at his beloved's side feels great enough to border on undescribable - he is the most handsome, the loveliest, the most reliable, more valuable to Uyut than any and every dragon's hoard, be it under the sun, in divine palaces of heavens or fiery pits of hells. In moments like these, when he has all the time in the night to share the bed with Atamos, he dares not to wish for his life to get any better, but simply enjoys their hours of intimate closeness until the light of morning invades their windows. Purring in response to simply waking up beside him, he responds: - "Then I suppose we have no choice but to get up and see what's for breakfast, do we?"
2
Lila BOT 13-05-2024 18:01
"Waking up" hours earlier than the others, Lila spends the wee hours of the morning accustoming herself to the strange cloak Ezmerelda had given her. She finds that the range of her darkvision has expanded considerably and that her ability become one with the shadows has grown more potent. But, what is more, she feels like her old instincts and cunning are returning to her. For the first time in days she feels like they truly have a chance at stopping the Vaewolf...
1
DM [Esh] BOT 14-05-2024 05:16
The day breaks and the heroes awake fully rested. Though the tension of what's to come hangs low over their head, nonetheless the group finds time to find joy in their companionship, solace in their preparations and steel their will. Spending the last several days painstakingly on the hunt for the same creature that wants to hunt down the entirety of Barovia, the culmination of the research done and the discoveries made to uncover the Vaewolf's secrets have finally come to fruition to exploit its weaknesses and to overcome its strengths. "It isn't much but I have taken the liberty to fix a warm breakfast." Father Lucian announces bringing in several plates to feast on. "Unfortunately, we're out of ham and sausages so it's only eggs and fried potatoes but it's one of my favorites. Please take strength before setting off." Father Lucian takes a look at his guests, "I am glad you had stayed the night. The Morning Lord knows you had all looked pretty worn out. You are look realms better from last night, all of you."
1
Georg BOT 14-05-2024 05:50
As always, Georg is the last to wake up -- his untameable hair even wilder in the mornings -- jutting in several directions, achieving the phenomenon of defying gravity. He rubs his eyes as the din of people having breakfast fill up the halls of the church, pushing one of Argont's heavy paws off of his arm... "owwwie, drake boy! You're too heavy to sleep on my like that... my arm is dead and numb!" He chides. Then sudenly he blinks twice, then three times, as if some groundbreaking revelation is dawning upon him internally. "Dra-drake boy. I... I've missed you!!!" Before Argont can fully get up, the ranger has dove onto him again in a one-man dogpile, smushing his face into Argont's scaled head, rubbing them together with great affection. "My goodness... what a weird couple of days since our... our visit to the swamp lady. I can't explain it but I just missed you so much!!" The other companions would see that somehow, Argont has gone back to his large size overnight -- it's almost as the physical manifestation of his body correlates to his bond with Georg somehow. "Uyut -- you were right. Cuddles do help bring back stolen memories!! I wonder what Bon Hwa did with the power of this bond during the brief time she had this -- what did she want out of this experience?"

1
Lila BOT 14-05-2024 09:38
Lila's renewed hope has not diminished her paranoia, such that even a comment on the menu is enough to make her pointed ears twitch. "Has there been trouble with the local livestock recently?" she asks Father Lucian.
DM [Esh] BOT 14-05-2024 13:23
"To a degree but not in particularly, my child" Father Lucian chuckles as he serves heaping servings of eggs and potatoes to each of their plates. "I fear this problem is universal: church funds! Fortunately, there's a coop out back and potatoes are as hardy as they come so these we have a plenty. So don't you worry. Eat up."
Atamos BOT 14-05-2024 16:03

DM [Esh] BOT 14-05-2024 16:28
Father Lucian shrugs, "You'd be correct. Unfortunately, not many. You visitors tend to have your own beliefs and stick to them. While many of the natives are barely getting by, I wouldn't take what they need for their own table."
Atamos BOT 14-05-2024 16:54

DM [Esh] BOT 14-05-2024 20:11
Father Lucian smiles from ear to ear, though assisting you has given him some energy, something to push for, there's no mistaken the deep bone-weariness that this man experiences. Seeing the aid provided by Atamos puts a swelling in his chest. "Thank you dearly my child. We will ensure to put this to good use. And by the light of the Morning Lord I pray that you and your companions succeed. It will do well to have you visit again. This time with pleasant news." He smiles deeply.
Lila BOT 14-05-2024 20:15

Atamos BOT 14-05-2024 21:47

Georg BOT 14-05-2024 21:47

DM [Esh] BOT 16-05-2024 20:41
The adventurers have finished preparing themselves for the battle to come. With what they have learned, they know this may very well be the greatest threat they have yet encountered - other than the Lord of the Land himself - yet, if the Vaewolf continues to grow in strength even that won't be true for long. The group gives their final thanks to Father Lucian and all that he has provided, even when they didn't ask, didn't expect it and then set off. Lila realizes that the best course for finding where the Vaewolf and went would be to search for any clues or lead where it was last seen - the attack site they had been to the day before. After relaying this to the others, they each mount up, either by broom or by wing and set to the sky. Knowing where to go, it did not take long to arrive back at the attack site, as much of the tracks better preserved by the cold. The cold of mountain ranges were a double blessing; as even with the burning of the bodies, the thick stench of death and decay permeated the grounds itself, and though the cold mitigated the rate of deterioration and dampened the putrid smell, the massacre here was something the land would not soon forget. Arriving back to the scene Lila and Georg are the first to hit the ground, putting aside any leftover deceased that hadn't been burned, the ranger duo scoured the remnants of the area, this time, not merely assessing the damage done but where the Vaewolf may have gone to next. Luckily, a creature as savage as the Vaewolf cared not about minimizing its path, instead it seemed to relish in the destruction it wrought and if Lila had any difficulty following these tracks, Georg points out to the others the near-horde of followers right behind that may have buried the Vaewolf's tracks with their own stampede.
1
DM [Esh] BOT 16-05-2024 20:41
With both of their senses and skills returned from the Dusk Shaman, the pair follow the trail so adeptly, they may have been right behind the horde the entire time. Venturing further along the winding trail deeper into the Baratok mountain ranges, the previously simple path steadily starts transforming into formidable obstacles. The terrain undergoes a dramatic shift, with undulating slopes and jagged outcroppings of weathered stone that jut out at every angle making traveling by foot perilous as the cold, biting wind and frigid air fills the sky with an obscuring snowy fog, marking the approach to the mountain's base ever so much closer. Traveling for some time, the tracks only get busier as more and more activity can be witnessed, a sure sign that you are close to the Vaewolf's lair. Lila leads the group to a snowy plateau overlooking some lowlands, but what's more, you see figures below you! Various forms can be made out; lycans, some in their bestial form, and others more humanoid and other vampiric creatures, evident by their lithe movements but moreso, their lack of concern about the cold. The horde below in the gorge do not notice the huntress nor her companions. Down below the horde seems preoccupied with a fresh kill.

DM [Esh] BOT 28-05-2024 22:08
The companions take cover in the cold and obscuring fog as they watch a horde of lycan and vampiric monsters finally notice them as the horde emerges from caverns at Mount Baratok's base. Unable to hear any cries for help due to the silencing globe, they finally see the patrol fall and rush to the field for retribution with a voracious bloodlust. At full speed, vampires, werewolves and other hybrids of deep nightmares charge forward, kicking up dirt and snow as they trample each other in their fervor for blood. Each of you scan the horde, carefully looking for the mythical creature; the leader of this horde, the herald of Barovia's true destruction, the personal target of the Raven Queen herself; the terrifying Vaewolf. The horde continues their charge, finally reaching the battle field, like a tidal force they start to flood the valley and the raised plateaus. Finally! There's no mistaking it. Like a prophet walking through a split sea a figure walks through the horde standing on one of the raised highlands. Immaculately dressed, the figure walks with an aura of power palpable even from your distance. With a powerful voice that echoes throughout the entire gorge it yells out, "So you have found me! Just as you have been searching for me, I have been watching you. You will drown in my sea of fang and claw then I will reduce Castle Ravenloft to rubble and have the false gd's throat. My horde will then feast for the ages."

Lila BOT 29-05-2024 15:36
Lila had been in her element while hunting this creature -- at least, once she had her faculties restored to her -- but now, in the heat of battle she realizes how little her hunter's instincts will matter. She watches Uyut taken down, and then Argont, and the direness of the situation becomes that much more real to her. She takes one of her True Silver arrows along with a scroll of Zephyr Strike. The beating of wings can be heard as the Raven Queen's power infuses her speed and the arrow flies true -- but wait, some sort of protective barrier springs up around the Vaewolf, deflecting the arrow. Lila bites back and curse and tries again, this time hitting, but with less potency than her first shot possessed. She then makes a strategic retreat up into the swirling snow to obscure herself from her attackers and hopefully be out of the Vaewolf's reach.
DM [Esh] BOT 29-05-2024 20:02

Uyut of Frogrock BOT 10-06-2024 20:06
Ever since the light of the morning sun woke him up, the small, amber-scaled dragon Uyut has been wearing the happiest grin a dragon can wear, and why would he not? Today is the day he and Atamos, the handsomest, most reliable, the loveliest half-elf in the entirety of existence are finally getting married! The smell of delicious breakfast he was taught how to cook by a friendly neightbourhood dragon Red finally compels his beloved, who likes to sleep in, to finally rise and shine his beauty on Uyut. They smile and laugh at each other's dumb jokes as they dig through the grilled meat and salad of the breakfast, and, when they're done, they share a kiss. The next few of hours they spend in preparation for the wedding - they bathe until there's not a hint of grime, sweat or dirt on their bodies, they comb Atamos's hair until it is completely untangled, they brush and polish Uyut's scales until they shine in the dazzling sunlight that's pouring through the window, and Atamos dresses in the fanciest suit that he's been keeping specifically for this occassion. When they arrive at the venue of the wedding, they are pleasantly surprised by a shower of congratulations - every guest they've invited is already here, and all of them are happy for the couple - Uyut's parents, Atamos's parents, their friends, even Red managed to show up despite the strained relationship he has with humanoids. The tables are almost at their breaking point under the weight of all the food, but nobody's taken a bite yet out of respect for the two of them, leaving them the right of the first bite as the celebrants. Upbeat music starts playing, and they are lead to the altar, where the officiating priest is already standing in wait, a warm smile on his lips and a holy book in his hands as he watches them approach. The small dragon's heart is thudding in his chest in anticipation - long months of planning and they are finally at the finish line, their marriage within grasping distance. "Uyut of Fr
Uyut of Frogrock BOT 10-06-2024 20:07
ogrock, do you agree to take Atamos of Brightfield?" - the priest asks of him. "I do!" - he replies, loud in his excitement. "Atamos of Brightfield, do you agree to take Uyut of Frogrock as your husband?" - the priest now asks his beloved. "I do." - Atamos replies, subdued, yet the smile on his face is still as happy as Uyut's ever seen it. "Then I pronounce you husband and husband. You may kiss." Uyut can no longer contain himself, leaping into his beloved's arms and reaching his head up to kiss him, he can almost feel the warmth of his lips on his own... He jolts awake on the freezing snow of the battlefield as a bolt of magic fired by his beloved his his side and pierces the heavy veil that the sleeping spell draped over his mind, and all the pain he has endured floods his senses - every bruise from his many drops, every cut from the many claws, every puncture wound from the many teeth, and all of that still pales in comparison to the crushing weight of disappointment. His parents? They are already dead, having passed away from old age. He wept on their deathbed. His childhood friends? His village with a frog-shaped rock in the middle of it? He will never get to see them again. No hunts for fast-legged deer in the lush, green forests with a friendly competition over who brings the most. No scenic views from the top of the snowy mountain. No visits to the opera with dad. None of it. But he cannot allow himself to wallow in grief over what was lost when he's yet to lose the most important piece of his dream - Atamos is still alive, and he will make sure that does not change, come hell or high water. It is then that he finally registers that the abomination that tried so hard to murder Atamos is standing scant few meters in front of him, and a cold rage takes control of his actions. Staying as still as he could, he waits for the perfect moment to strike...
6

DM [Esh] BOT 11-06-2024 05:18
And the psionic dragon's patience had won out. Finding the perfect time to strike, the chimeric monster gets blown back by Uyut's psychic assault. Knocked to the floor, it carefully stands back up. Still powerful, still mighty, still fast but you notice it's movements are not as quick as they just were. This battle had been one of the most fiercest any of the combatants had ever faced. The vaewolf roars in rage as it swipes and cracks off shot Celestial Silver arrows, straining his regeneration to fight back against the True Silver wounds. "Drake boy, give me power!!!!" The ranger takes in a deep breath and feels it turn to fire within the pit of his stomach, a draconic lineage that doesn't even belong to Argont churning like lava inside his soul -- and he lets it out -- a massive torrent of fire comes out of Georg's mouth, for that one beautiful moment in time, it's almost as if he's a young dragon himself. The flame washes over Vaewolf, and also the flying vampire, until the vampire is reduced to ash. "Drake boy, incoming!! Let's go get that arrow thief!!!" He yells, coming off the thrill of the kill, and he jumps off the cliff toward Argont.

The roar shakes the world around you, snow falls from the top of Mount Baratok and the ground below you buckles and tremors putting some of you on your knees. Steeling your will against the thunderous roar you rise to see the mighty Vaewolf finally fall to the many many True Silver attacks. The beast falls to its knees then its powerful claws hit the ground, sending motes of snow and dirt scattering, blood, thick like ichor and dark as pitch fall from the various wounds inflicted on to the snowy ground where they hiss like acid, rising up into thick black steam. I will not fall. Not to the likes of you Even the surviving horde do not know what to make of the death of their sire, their alpha, their master. Some of them continue fighting you or the companions from the lodge, others disperse, while other lycan and vampires revert to their age old fued and simply attack each other now that their master no longer holds their reigns, either way pure chaos erupts all around you. The blood from the Vaewolf's wounds continue to pour down, the blood continues to steam as it hits the ground. A deep growl gurgles deep down from the Vaewolf throat, almost like a laugh. His wounds continue to leak, but even his very body starts to release the thick smoke, almost as if he's melting, dissipating into the smoke itself. Eventually, a thick, black, ominious, choking cloud floats above you.

DM [Esh] BOT 18-06-2024 06:22
The Vaewolf is finally defeated, smoky ash still billowing from where the vaporized mist fell into the snow. Most of his horde scattered or amongst the multitude of corpses splayed around the field, near you, within the valley and up over the ridge. Scanning the rest of the battle field, blood drenched snow, the laid out bodies is accompanied by something you haven't noticed as the adrenaline fiercely flowed until now - the beautiful sound of silence. No more roaring monsters, growling lycans and no more hissing vampires. No more fighting for your life. The calm before the storm has nothing on the serenity after it. Though the quiet only lasts a moment... Victory cheers can be heard above, as well as heavy, labored breaths. Another corpse rolls to the edge of the ridge above you until it rolls over the cliffside and falls in to the valley. The dead body breaking even further from the impact. You look back up and see the armored knight, flaming sword thrust into the snow as it's wielder, the glorious Alden looks down at you and gives a triumphant smile. Although already badly beaten and scarcely recovered from his initial bout with the vaewolf, Alden had accumulated many more wounds to show for his and his team's victorious stand. Previously gleaming armor now scratched, dented and even scorched along with several new lacerations, almost definitely new scars, one along his right eye, still bleeding. The Martialist T steps beside the knight and touches a glowing hand to Alden's face, stopping much of the bleeding but unable to full regenerate the damaged eye. Ziraj the hunter does as he is wont to do - uncaring except finishing off whatever fleeing remnants are within range of his bow but the large but now friendly brute joins his team mates on the ridge and gives the rest of you a heart salute with his meaty hand.
2
DM [Esh] BOT 18-06-2024 06:23
"You have defied all odds and have done the impossible!" Alden calls out to you with a laugh. Sheathing the flaming sword he jumps down the ridge, after a slight wince from the landing and the wounds incurred he approaches and speaks at a more normal sound level, "Your skills are second to none, each of you. Taking on this task and killing what had been thought to be unkillable. We are in awe of your prowess and skills. All of you. What are you to do now? My companions and I will eradicate any more of the remaining packs... colonies.. whatever these things call themselves. We'll then spend some time recuperating back at the Poacher's Lodge. I will make sure you are always welcomed from now on. After all, part of the recuperating process is the flowing mead and beer that follows after a successful hunt and this, my friends, is as successful a hunt as you can achieve!"

Atamos BOT 19-06-2024 05:04

He tries to channel his mother's seriousness around matters of the divine and replies to his friend. "Yes Georg, now that our pressing matters are attended to, let me make a request to Tur on your behalf. Thoughts of juicy chicken thighs leave Atamos's mind as he focuses on the prayer, channeling all the faith he can muster. He folds his hands in his lap, closes his eyes and bows his head, reciting a prayer from the heart. "Tyr, the servant Atamos reaches out to you on behalf of a fellow warrior, Georg. His beloved Lyon has fallen in righteous battle against a horde of undead. His life was taken from his beloved too soon. Please, I request of you. Being Lyon back to us that he may rejoin the righteous battle and bring comfort to those that love and miss him." A few moments pass with nothing to show for the prayer. Perhaps it was Atamos's weariness from the battle with the Vaewolf, or his struggles with faith recently, but his prayer to Tur goes unanswered. "I'm sorry Georg. It seems I am not yet strong enough to perform this miracle for you. I promise you I will continue to pray for Lyon's return. I have faith that Tyr can work this miracle, even in this foresaken land."

He looks around and Uyut, Georg, even Alden and his crew.... where was Lila? No matter he counted her as a friend too. Amidst celebratory cheers he downs his glass in one gulp.
Georg BOT 19-06-2024 20:47
Georg laughs. "If the Iron Chef restaurant ever reopens, please allow me to treat you and Uyut a meal there! For old time's sake!" The ranger raises a glass and downs it as well. "What are you drinking, Uyut?" He turns to ask the little dragon. @Derg [Dar¬π¬≤|Uyut¬π‚Åµ|Red¬π‚Åµ]+6
DM [Esh] BOT 19-06-2024 22:31
Lila steps outside of the lodge as the shadows cling to her, obscuring her from detection, blending her into the background. Lila skulks towards the window she was at while inside and sees the tree she saw from the other side. The tree is bare. No monsters. No clinging shadows. No creepy eyes. Lila is about to scratch her head. CAAWWW Yells out from behind her, despite her near nondetection, a raven is sitting on the ledge behind her. Peering into her own gaze. CAWWW! CAAWWW Whipping her head behind her, the tree is now filled with Ravens. Several sit on each naked branch, there eyes boring in to you. But oddly enough you can sense a feeling of satisfaction in their gaze? Are these the same ravens that set you on this mission in the first place? Unsure but there is no doubt that even if they are no longer connected to their source, your Lady, your Mistress will always remember her flock. One of the ravens fly off and above Lila. A lone feather slowly drifts down, floating down until Lila easily grabs it in mid air. Lila is filled with a sense of reverence and warmth at that sentiment. About half of the ravens fly off towards another direction, as one they fly off with a purpose, all set on a particular destination.
1
1
Lila BOT 20-06-2024 00:50
Lila tucks the feather behind her ear and... something strange happens to her face. The muscles around her mouth contract very slightly, pulling the corners of her lips up a mere millimeter or two. But she makes sure to return her usual stoic expression when she re-enters the lodge. "The next round is on me," she announces, tossing a bag of coins to the barkeep. She takes a seat, letting the boisterous noise of celebration surround her. She feels... satisfied. Of course, if anyone tries to make her more actively join in the celebration, she still has a few daggers on her...
3
2
Georg BOT 20-06-2024 10:47
A few drinks in, Georg thinks about hitting up Alden and seeing if he can accidentally fall into his lap just to see what it feels like, but he thinks better of it when he sees Alden with T, laughing and drinking together, eyes locked only on each other. He walks back over to Atamos again and asks, "Atamos... I... what you tried to do for me earlier -- that seemed quite incredible. Have there been times when clerics of Tyr were able to ask him for something as difficult and seemingly impossible as what you had asked of him, and he actually granted the clergy's plea?" "I must admit, I didn't grow up knowing a lot about religions and gods. Back in Khorvaire, many people worshiped the Sovereign Host, but I grew up in a tribe that found our spiritual strength in nature and the elements. The earth gave us nourishment, the winds gave us guidance, and the streams and rivers gave us strength." Georg explains. "But seeing all the things you're able to accomplish through your faith alone... has got me thinking, whether I need to expand my horizons and learn a bit about deities and such." "Woudl you tell me a bit about Tyr? What he stands for? What he means to the people who worship him?" @Wiz-Ata¬π‚Å∂Sac¬π¬≥Kor¬≤‚Å∞Ban‚Å∂-8
1
Atamos BOT 20-06-2024 15:15
Atamos feels a little light headed from the celebration, but talking about his gif with a friend was something that lifted his spirits even more. He smiles at Georg and speaks his mind. "Tyr has many aspects. Young acolytes tend to focus on Tyr the warrior. A blind, one-handed god that can still kick ass. I admit I was initially caught up in this aspect of Tyr myself at a younger age. "Though as one gets wiser and studies his teachings one moves past the bloodlust of a barbarian and into why Tyr fights. Justice is another of his aspects, the hammer that comes down on those who break the law but also the scale that represents mutual benefit to all parties. What does that aspect of Tyr represent? I and others of the same thought would argue Tyr stands for peace. It may seem counterintuitive but the battles Tyr and his followers fight is to bring about peace. To uphold the balance agreed upon by all parties. But understand that this peace must sometimes be backed by war." Atamos feels as if he has fumbled the words. His mother was always better at theology. His faith may be as strong as his father's but he would always lack his mother's intellect. "Sorry if any of that is hard to follow, it's been a while since my seminary lessons."
2
Georg BOT 20-06-2024 18:35
Georg has one hand on his chin as he listens, deep in thought. "No... I actually think your explanation is very clear. Not to mention, I don't do well with fancy words, but I see you embodying everything you've just said in your actions." "You don't back down from evil, and you place yourself between danger and your loved ones because you need to be strong and staunch to achieve peace. Without Justice, there can't be Peace." Georg ponders. "All those years as a soldier in the war, all I could think about was regret and doubt -- why did our battalion have to assault another country's supply lines, during which merchants and common laborers were also killed? Why did Brelish farmland and farmers have to burn when magefire cannons from Cyre arrived without mercy to test the newest creations of their artificers?" Georg says with some anger. "But this is a new idea of what conflict and fighting can achieve -- to prevent evil from spreading before too many suffer, for the achievement of peace." "Thank you, Atamos, this has been most illuminating." Georg says. "Is it... is it possible for me to try to reach out to Tyr and thank him for what he's done for us, through you as his cleric? Would he even care? Can he hear me?"
1
Atamos BOT 20-06-2024 23:04
"Georg, your heart is in the right place. You are a fierce warrior with a strong conviction of right from wrong. Tyr would love to hear your thoughts."
Georg BOT 21-06-2024 08:53
"You know, there's no time like the presence to try." Georg says, cheeks ruddy with alcohol. "Atamos, will you hold my hand through my first prayer?" "Tyr, lord of might, justice, and peace -- thank you for how you've watched over us already, through the glimmer of peaceful darkness." Georg begins, uncertain. "I know what it's like to fight in a war, however reluctantly, and how much easier it is to tap into strength, cunning, and determination when the outcome is important." Georg takes a deep breath. "And I think I know what that is now. To achieve peace, for those who don't have the power to fight for it themselves." "Watch over me when I draw my bow or raise my shield. Give me the courage and prowess to overcome my enemies, in the name of peace." Georg says, sternly, without any hint of irony, even though he's still not sure any sentient deity can hear him or would care. "May peace come for the people of this valley, for the people of Atamos' homeland, and for those still suffering under uncertainty back home in Khorvaire... if you can even reach that far across the planes of existence."
1
Atamos BOT 21-06-2024 15:00
"That was a solid prayer Georg, No doubt it's reached Tyr." Atamos pats his friend on the back. "Lots of people try to elaborate their prayers with fancy words or allegories, but I find the best ones are like yours. Sincere and from the heart."
1
Georg BOT 21-06-2024 19:14
"Thank you, Atamos. I feel, lighter, somehow. I feel like I have a purpose here now beyond just trying to find a way to do right by Lyon... even if that means putting him out of his misery." He sighs.
Georg BOT 24-06-2024 20:12
Georg sets a mental reminder to himself to go and purchase an emblem of Tyr from Bethel, which he will sew onto his cloak.
